ah man. i'm finally making a review of this monstrosity.   might be the most divisive game for me when it comes to getting people to play it. on one hand it kick-starts my favorite game series and allows you to better understand the struggle of reaching the end. on the other it is a deeply frustrating game at times that demands the patience of a saint. or maybe it just demands you to be insanely masochistic. either one really.   but the struggle is the whole point. this game will tear you down and make you rethink your decisions in-game or otherwise lol. but it's when you learn from every tiny mistake until you reach perfection until you are able to clear the hardest days in the game without losing a single agent (except day 49 fuck that) that's when you realize it was all worth it.   though you will certainly be met with despair by pushing through this game the relief at the end and the tears of joy you will feel are unmatched anywhere else in any game and i mean any game pm works included. and once you are done you are able to experience the absolute peak of gaming brought to us by our lord and savior kim ji-hoon.   face the fear build the future and glory to project moon!

this game is a once in a lifetime experience. it can be brutally difficult at times and is 100% unique in its design and gameplay objective. this game also doubles as one of the best visual novels of all time. truly a work of art. i felt like a brand new person after playing this game and it will no doubt make you better at handling all hell breaking loose for the rest of your life if you are able to finish it.  if you are coming to this game as a limbus company fan be warned this is a 80-100 hour experience at minimum. if you are planning to watch the cutscenes from this game on youtube and skip the gameplay itself just know that the weight and meaning of those cutscenes is going to be completely lost on you. this game's plot immerses you into the hellish world of this company by putting you at the helm of it which is a crucial element to fully getting it whenever the concepts of this game are brought up in sequel games. do yourself a favor and just play this game properly from start to finish whenever you find the time. you do not need to play this game to be able to enjoy its sequel games but going through it will feel immensely rewarding if you do.

this is a mean game.   i bounced off lob. corp. a couple of times just because management games and visual novels take up completely different parts of my brain and it was hard to wrap my head around the fact that the visual novel looking parts were just the cut scenes and not the main part of the game. at this point i was treating the game more like a visual novel where the management parts were like a minigame to get characters to like you or something. i failed miserably on my first day and bounced off the game 4 times.   i had written it off as a game i didn't understand until a 45 minute video essay about how bizarre lobotomy corp was came across my feed and i'm nothing if not a sucker for the bizarre. i gave it a real try this time and made it to about day 9. fucking hell this game hates you. the basic concept is that you collect cabin in the woods/scp style nightmare monsters lock them in an underground vault and run experiments on them to generate electricity. you can run 1 of 4 different types of experiments and each one has different success rates based on the skills of your employees and the disposition of the monster. you don't know those rates until you run a few experiments and any failures can result in a containment breach and a rampaging monster killing everyone in the bunker. except almost every single monster has exceptions and extra rules to follow that you don't know until after some experiments. this was not a big deal when i had the first 1 or 2 levels of the bunker unlocked. use the purple research on grandma and don't go into her room when she's smoking or her depression will rub off on you. make sure somebody with good stats is checking on the scribble monster because even with the right research type the odds of success aren't great. don't touch the machine that has a big don't touch me label on it. i don't know what it's supposed to do but every time i mess with it bad things happen. lots of basic stuff like that. floor 3 is where the game really shows you just how much it hates you. first monster to be contained on floor 3 was some spiders. like a lot of spiders. naturally i sent a noobie in to make first contact. he died. instantly. ok i'll send in someone with a little more experience. he survived just long enough to get me some data before he started stepping on spiders and they hated that so they killed him. this went on for like 3 more days. someone would go in get a tiny bit of data then die. turns out they're really picky. try the white research? death. try to send in someone who doesn't have at least one point in white research? death. however every time they kill someone they add their body to a cocoon and you generate bonus energy based on the number of cocoons in the room when you finally get a success.   i took a break after this to gather my thoughts about if i even wanted to push forward with this game. in the time it had taken me to figure out how not to kill everyone who went into the spider room i had been given 2 more monsters to study and both of them seemed like they were going to be just as complex if not more so. just to clarify this game is also kind of an rts. the longer you take to meet your daily energy quota the higher the chances random events will happen to make things harder. the difficulty in this game isn't that it's twitchy or requires a perfect strategy it's in how many tiny quirks can you remember about each monster event and employee. every time you slip and forget a detail or even just miss-click everything will fall apart so fast that you just have to reset the day. sometimes the best you can hope for is that a containment breach doesn't cause too much damage and you can finish off your research and end the day before too many people die. there was one day i had to reset at least 15 times and the best result i could get was only 5 of my 15 employees dying. this wasn't just a case of me being bad at the game and save scumming. this is an intentional mechanic that's tied into the lore. at this point i really don't think this game is for me at least not in the long run. i had fun with the time i did put into it but i just don't think i'm masochistic enough to push the rest of the way through. it's fun weird has a bizarre sense of humor and breaks the 4th wall in ways that make it more immersive not less. it has a lot of good things going for it but it really takes the right kind of person to actually see all the neat stuff on offer. yes i do recommend lobotomy corp but be prepared to hate this game. even if you finish it lob. corp. hates you and expects you to hate it back.

this is the game that changed my entire viewpoint on the world and altered my mind to points that i cannot fathom. my life has genuinely been ruined and helped by this game alone and i cannot begin to explain why. my brain has rotted to a point of no return to the point where i feel as if i am the manager. this isn't no game. this is a mirror world designed with the purpose of killing and torturing its user endlessly and painfully and you have to watch the people of the city die and be mercilessly slaughtered because of this one corporation. thank you project moon but also you will be paying for my future therapy.

i am a 45 yo father probably one of the oldest people playing this game. i am a single father to my son who is 14 now. my son got this game for christmas in 2021 from his uncle so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. by the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. this was horrible for me as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son as he is always out with his friends or just watching youtube. so i decided to make a steam account and get this game to see if i could maybe play alongside him. i loaded into the game picked my character and world and started playing but i was stuck on what you where supposed to do. i asked my son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. i loved it as it was the best time i had spent with my son since my wife had died. this game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. this game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything and it has brought both me and my son many happy memories.

[h1] another perfect day in our north korea paradise! let us give thanks to our supreme leader! [/h1]  lobotomy corporation is a great game i would even say one of the best games i ever played in my entire life.  the game has a management mechanic where you need to assign proper employees to certain abnormalities to work with in order to generate enough energy to meet the everyday quota. you are manager so nearly everything depends on you what abnormalities to contain how you will strengthen your employees what sacrifices you will make and how many times your ass will burn with a bright blue flame. only masochists will love this game and hell glad i am one of them. it is actually really [b] fun [/b] game especially when you nearly finished your quota on late days and accidentally abnormality breaches your defenses and starts to wreak havoc killing your employees and freeing more beasts and you look at this with a smile knowing that you have to repeat an entire day [b] again [/b]. still love this game will probably play more. have a nice day.

a management simulation game with a twist that starts off slow but ramps up in difficulty to nearly sadistic levels by the mid-to-late game. it won't be for everyone and the difficulty will filter a lot of people but if you enjoy an extreme challenge this is definitely worth giving a chance.  additionally is the first game in project moon's ongoing story universe (followed up by library of ruina and limbus company) with an extremely interesting and compelling narrative that by itself could be worth the price of admission.

the story is good gameplay is fine if you like manager simulators. with each passing day game becomes exponentialy more difficult so expect to restart from the beginning if you come underprepared and hit a wall. the game is designed for you to restart several times and you retain partial progress between each playthrough. don't expect an easy story mode trip even with guides this game is a serious challenge and gridning won't help you much. also the game is terribly optimized and start to lag hard if you got a lot of stuff happening in your facility at once.   overall not a game for everyone. if you like scp setting want a good story and not afraid of a challenge i recommend trying it out.   good luck manager.

if you have played a lot of games you might know these feelings: i have seen this before a lot of times this is just like game x with a different setting. if you want something truly unique and creative a game with a lot of personality then lobotomy corporation might be what you seek.   lobotomy corporation is a management game with strategy elements and a focus on narrative. it draws inspiration from the scp universe but only in concept. it is entirely unique.   in this game you semi-randomly get so called abnormalities each new day. these are kind of paranormal entities that exist in this universe. some strange some horrifying some funny. some helpful some dangerous some very dangerous you have to work with these abnormalities and find out what they are capable of and how to prevent them from breaching or causing disasters.  since it is semi-random (you can choose between 3 randomly each day) what abnormality you get each run can be pretty different in how you need to run your facility what to keep track of and how to tackle emergency situations when abnormalities eventually breach or cause a chain reaction of chaos.   it is pretty fun to learn about the abnormalities and try to figure out a strategy on how to handle each day in your facility. because handling one abnormality isn't a problem handling multiple ones growing each day that all have different needs and abilities that can influence each other can prove difficult but almost always manageable.   speaking of management that is your role. as the new manager you run this facility. train new employees tell them what to do and of course figure out what to do in each situation. depending on how well you did each day you earn points which you can spend on employees hiring and strengthening them. when working with abnormalities you can also aquire grear from them which you need to tackle even more dangerous abnormalities and other dangerous situation.  at first there is a good chance you will feel overwhelmed after playing the tutorial with all those informations but it will sink in in no time. and once you understand it it isnt even that hard to grasp. speaking of difficulty the game starts of fairly easy and steadily gets more difficult over time. but eventually you will encounter some drastic difficulty spikes. especially near the end of the game  the game can be somewhat repetetive in the middle part of the game but it will get interesting again quickly with varying unique ordeals the game throws at you.   one big downside is unfortunately that ui is pretty bad and the controls very clunky. but since you can pause (mostly at least) to order your employees around this isn't such a big deal.  the soundtrack in this game is also pretty good and very unique. fits the game mostly well. however some tracks can get a bit repetetive since there aren't that many tracks and the game is around 100 hours long if you want 100% (without looking at guides of course).  the story is pretty interesting and i enjoyed progressing and hearing more of this world.    overall this game is a very unique immersive interesting challenging and fun experience i can recommend to anyone who  wants to play a game that is a totally new experience for the most part. and of course to anyone who likes the genres this game falls into. if you like a bit of strategy mystery management and immersion try it out! just keep in mind that it can be kind of clunky at times. but other than that i had as a pretty picky gamer a surprisingly great time with this game through most of my playtime.

this game is one that i really love whether it's the compelling storyline that keeps players hooked alike to the aroma of a steak that makes you crave more or the gameplay that is equally ravishing allowing for replayability whenever one feels ready for a fresh experience. i give you a warm welcome to lobotomy corporation.  story: in this game players assume the role of a new manager of an energy production facility. however this is no ordinary power plant as it involves an unconventional method of energy production through the care of peculiar entities known as abnormalities. assisting us are ai companions angela the most human-like ai in the world and sephirot(the department head) guiding us through our tasks. the secrets buried in the past and the conclusion of this facility remain unknown with only you the manager knowing. tell me manager. do you have any wishes?  gameplay: in this game players manage the energy production facility for fifty days divided into three phases: story phase deployment phase and management phase.  story phase: narrates the main storyline and sephirot's subplot in a visual novel format. deployment phase: players choose one abnormality from three options each day unlock and upgrade facility areas based on sephirot's tasks completed the previous day and manage our agents by hiring developing or equipping them with e.g.o equipment (weapons/suits) for the next phase.  management phase: the most challenging and headache-inducing part if players aren't adequately prepared. in this phase players manage the facility to meet the energy production quota per day by sending agents to work with abnormalities to product energy. when the energy production quota is met the day can end or players can continue with sephirot's tasks earning lob points to hire or develop agents in the deployment phase. however if this were all it wouldn't be the most headache-inducing part. before diving into management let's get acquainted with the abnormalities the core that will make players' heads ache. abnormalities are divided into five risk levels: zayin teth he waw and aleph with aleph being the most dangerous. each level provides varying amounts of energy. whenever agents work with abnormalities they not only receive energy but also pe boxes. pe boxes are used to unlock information or exchange for e.g.o equipment. the information obtained includes management tips work preferences indicating the efficiency of each type of work and escape information indicating whether an abnormality is close to escaping. if an abnormality escapes players have only three options: start a new day suppress it or fervently pray to end the day as quickly as possible. and if this isn't enough to capture your interest the game features random events or ordeals occurring during work with abnormalities making everything even more precarious than before. our new technology will bring salvation to humanity.  the reason i love this game comes from its gameplay which is quite challenging for newcomers. however once you understand it to some extent it becomes something interesting providing a fresh and exciting experience while still keeping you hooked. but there are minor frustrations that might arise especially if you play for an extended period causing you to occasionally lag from playing.  on the story side it's not suitable for children contrasting with visuals that might seem appealing to all ages. it includes elements like blood violence and substance abuse but they are used appropriately to create a complex and intense storyline that invites further exploration. the attention to detail put into the abnormalities' lore some of which may be related to characters encountered during the game is impeccable. it's unpredictable isn't it?  from both gameplay and story perspectives i recommend this game for those unafraid of blood who enjoy immersing themselves in a narrative or those seeking out unique gaming experiences. face the fear make the future

lobotomy corporation while definitively not for everyone is a very difficult and engaging management simulation with an interesting setting and incredible world building.  this game is hard and not always rewarding. it's a slog to get through to put it mildly. the playtime is heavily padded by the need for restarts/resets whether that's a single day 5 days or even the entire campaign. that's not to say it's bad however. learning how to properly manage the abnormalities and combat the various challenges that arise is what makes the game so great. it doesn't hold your hand you have to learn it on your own.  helping you along your journey are a colorful cast of characters. each has their own issues and backstory and learning about them as you progress really makes you feel invested. the story as well is very creative and engaging.  there are some moments where i think the game could have made it more clear how to do better. towards the end especially it's very easy to hard-lock yourself out of finishing the game and needing to reset so i feel the conditions should have been made more clear to the player.  the soundtrack provides a great atmosphere and tone setter for the game getting more intense as the challenge does. the atmosphere overall also really sets the mood for the grimy and dark world the game is set in.  overall score: 8/10  positive points - mechanics - world building - story and characters - soundtrack  negative points - difficulty unfair often - some things should be more clear to the player

lobotomy corporation  a game that somehow made me feel less depressed and absolutely miserable at the same time. my consensus; this game is terrible there is nothing good about this game. yet somehow i felt enticed enough by the story and unique gameplay to trudge through it. needless to say the performance is terrible in later stages sometimes dropping down to 5 fps or crashing without any reason. how this game is extremely buggy with with a lot of strange occurrences that ultimately make the game more personalized per person and machine needs to be studied somewhere this game is an absolute mystery on how it can run despite being held together by: shoelaces instant noodles and a dream. therefore i can commend this game on that due to it's small dev team and extremely low starting budget. there's a lot to this game that will ultimately make you sink 80+ hours into it this game will make you want to come back over and over and over again to bash your head into this game until it is finally completed. giving yourself to this game and getting spat back out as a different person is apart of the experience. (least it was for me) cherish your time with your employees customize them to your hearts content feel attached to them and watch them perish right before your eyes as you get taught how to let go of things better than most games that have attempted can. how they managed to have an extremely intertwined story to gameplay (pain) experience is beyond me. before you even attempt to purchase this game ask yourself whether or not you can handle the many hurdles this game will put you through. as this game is an absolute nightmare of an experience that will rock your shit!  i do however recommend this game to anyone experiencing it anyway that is possible to you. what i mean by this is that you should either watch someone play through the game or attempt to experience the pain this game has to offer. heck you could even go on fucking roblox and play some game with characters references weapons etc from this game and have some sort of experience with this game. this game is an enigma that's extremely difficult to disregard the existence of. please experience this game in anyway you can. even looking through the wiki for 40 minutes is enough.  tl;dr game is cool not very well put together very hard game very painful game life changing experience will change you fucked up game very fucked up experience game pls very good for you

this game uses its concept as an scp inspired management sim in a lot of really creative and unexpected ways over time shifting your understanding of the mechanics and how you can/should approach problems. please go into the game knowing that resetting days or from checkpoints isn't bad or a sign that you've failed- its a necessary part of the process and a very important mechanic thats built into the gameplay loop. you actually need to discover the nature of these volatile entities through trial and error and the ways their traits manifest in both work and battle will not cease to surprise you. they also can interact with one another and the games world if you're not careful making information gathering and re-approaching days and parts of the facility vital.

i first heard that you will need to restart day quite frequently i didn't believe it until i first experienced a violet noon ordeal 10/10 would have all my employees explode again and most likely will- real review up ahead   [h1]gameplay[/h1]  in this section i will go over the gameplay loop and give basic advice this review meant to help people decide if they should pick up the game onto the actual review. the gameplay is somewhat complex. you start with one abnormality and gain more as time goes on along with this you will need to hire and manage employees to work on abnormalities to gain pe boxes if you reach the quota you can move on to the next day or continue working. with each abnormality you have four work options being.  [b]instinct[/b]-which corresponds to fortitude and the color red fortitude determines your employees health this is effected by red damage black damage and pale damage which will do damage based on how much health your employee has.  [b]insight[/b]-which corresponds to prudence and the color white prudence determines the amount of sanity your employees have and is effected by white and black damage if it drops to zero your employee will panic and these effects will change depending on your employee's highest stat  [b]attachment[/b]-which corresponds to temperance and the color black. temperance will effect work speed and success chance and this damage type does both health and sanity damage  [b]repression[/b]-which corresponds to justice and the color pale(blue for some reason) justice effects movement and attack speed of your employees and this damage type deal percentage based damage.  -picking the wrong option on an abnormality will make you more likely to fail working with them. -as you work with each respective stat it will level up which is important for determining work success the higher your work success the more pe boxes you get -each abnormality has their own pe boxes you can use to buy suits and weapon for your employees   and after you finish a day you get to the visual novel section of the game which is where the surprisingly deep story is i will not touch on it to avoid spoilers    [h1]music[/h1]  the music in this game is incredible however more often than not you will not be able to hear it because if an alternate track than the neutral theme (outside of the story tracks) is playing something has gone wrong and may be more worth it to restart the day  [b]i'm not going to be going over the story yet as i haven't seen much of it[/b]   [h1]summary[/h1]  in summary i think this game is worth your time and if your are a fan of these management type of games should totally check out

this game is agony. it's the dark souls of management simulations. i spent more time in this game than i did ds12 and 3 *combined*.  it's also one of the best examples of in-game mechanics reflecting in-game story exemplified in the boss battles quirks or even more meta-narratively (cognition filter or how the gameplay it feels like an endless cycle of pulling yourself through a bed of glass shards reflecting the in-story reality).  this is not a fun game it's not even particularly engaging but there's depths to the gameplay and story that are truly gripping.  -- my advice to players: retrying a day and more importantly resetting to a checkpoint (5 day check) and resetting back to the start (day 1 of 50). will and must occur repeatedly. accept it. embrace it. doing the early days over again is easy relative to the later challenges. you will only make your suffering worse if you don't use all 3 resets and frequently or you keep trying the 24hr day resets without going back to a 5 day checkpoint of a full-resets. look up how to use 5 day resets to 'learn' a monster and gather ego gear..because once you have it and know it *it stays with you*.   do the side-missions as soon as you are able and do the boss battles. they're game-changing and some are so powerful it's worth instantly reseting to day 1 to play with the improvements.  i recommend you do play with mods though particularly ones that let you save your agents on resets or ones that improve quality of life.

[h1][b]face the fear build the future.[/b][/h1] [hr][/hr] i'll try to keep this review [b]spoiler free[/b] because there is a overarching plot in this story that builds up into this grand finale of a stage play and it's best to go into this game blind to experience it yourself.  if you're into management sims that has punishing-but-satisfying gameplay and turns into an rts when an abnormality (the game's term for the monsters) breaches their containment or if you're just a fan of cataloging and managing monsters beyond your comprehension then this game is for you.  [b]the gameplay[/b] is punishing. yeah that's no exaggeration. lobotomy corporation at the very start when you have none of the abnormalities researched is a game of trial and error. you will not be able to beat the game on your very first try. think of it as a rogue-like but when you die you can still restart the day. eventually though you'll hit a major road block i.e: an abnormality might be too strong for your employees to handle that or a certain abnormality breaks out because its guidelines conflict with another abnormality's requirements.  but that's strangely the fun of it because when you restart to the first day certain progress doesn't get lost. sure your employees and your abnormalities may be lost but your research progress on abnos the missions you complete that continue the story for each department and their respective rewards the ego weapons and suits you get from abnos they all stay. so you have this slow climb of power and at certain points you may not even realize you do.   you'll know which abnormalities to take with you and which you shouldn't because of conflicts that might arise or you might even take them on purpose because you want a challenge or you simply want to watch your employees absolutely decimate them with the new gear you got.  this game can be punishing but it's rewarding that triumph you feel when you overcome an obstacle you never managed to hurdle over until now. that's what pulled me into the game and if this intrigues you i highly suggest you get the game.  just be ready to hear the first five notes play again and again until enough employees die and abnos break out. speaking of which this leads me to the next section:  [b]the music[/b]. it's phenomenal there's no questions about it. each warning (there's three) perfectly represents the situation you're in and the music during cutscenes really sell the atmosphere they're trying to go for. the only thing i have a problem with is the music when there's nothing happening in the game also known as neutral 01 to neutral 04. they are all identical in melody. actually it's the exact same song but the difference between all four neutral sound tracks are the additions of instruments into each one. this can work in its own right but most of the time you won't even notice the difference during gameplay until you pay attention to it.  otherwise the music is great. crazy impressive for just 10 people working on the game.  [b]the story[/b] is great. that's all i can really say about it without going into spoiler territory. it can be pretty surface level at some points but as you keep progressing you become entrenched in the lobotomy corp's worldbuilding and its religion and [spoiler]stage play[/spoiler] theming. it leaves off a lot of questions to be answered in their sequel game [b]library of ruina[/b] and i cannot recommend this game more because of the story.  the background art the abnormality artwork and the ego items they're all really good. they're not pure masterworks that award goes to library of ruina but for what it is i like it. [spoiler]there's even a reason later as to why your employees look the way they do in game[/spoiler].  overall this game gets a 9/10. this game is absolutely worth its price and i would have paid more if i could. i hope you enjoy the game as much as i did. just remember to face the fear so you can build the future.  and one more thing if this review sells you on getting it: if you find a small bird with a red stomach a long bird with a scale on its neck and bandaged face and a big bird with many eyes let them all escape at once. you'll get something cool out of it.  just be ready because there lives a beast lives in the black dusky forest.

have you ever painstakingly worked harder and harder barely scraping by until day 46 only to quit out to the main menu and redo the tutorial? just to see if you're doing it right?  turns out they lied. the real game wasn't managing the abnormalities. it was managing the constant deplete in energy the repeated ordeals that just get more difficult to predict and adapt meltdown after meltdown after meltdown praying something doesn't go wrong. that the mimic won't just snap one day and eat your innocent level 5 employee at only -6 overload relapsing the entire 2 hour day. that you won't have to deal with the invulnerable worms next dusk. that the meltdown doesn't target the one abnormality you can't deal with much less all of them. that the tiny white clothed girl doesn't just so happen to wipe out half your facility with a single attack unleashing two of the meanest abnormalities you have under containment triggering a chain reaction of every other abnormality breaking containment slaughtering all your employees through proceedingly more intricate methods. what was i talking about again? right red riding hood sucks. did i mention white and black are now my least favorite colors? i'm pretty sure the facility layout is based on the rings of hell. i survived undertale with the help of a tree but everyone else died and the mimic killed me later anyway. can someone tell me if the memory repository takes your egos away too? man this plot is kinda confusing.  anyway the game is pretty fun. if you're easily drawn into fictional worlds have a life and enjoy persevering through un and im possible odds you'll find that this game is not for you! you will not win the game won't let you. you'll quit within the first 5 hours 10 hours 50 hours and look back on it as a failure. you'll tell yourself you'll finish it one day and never will. even if you do manage to get one ending you'll never get the others. even if you get the endings you'll never get all the abnormalities. even if you 100% the game you'll never be satisfied. you failed. everything was for naught. how do we escape this hell we live in?  fun game.  ||edit|| now that i've doubled my playtime i've learned the truth. this game isn't hard it's actually kind of easy. in fact i'm gonna say it the game is only hard because the hitboxes for literally everything are terrible. that and you have literally no direction for how your supposed to properly manage the corporation. no i'm not talking about the abnormalities if those guys are giving you trouble it's either because you don't know how to read or you're bad at the game described as managing abnormalities. what i actually mean by manage the corporation is grinding your employees to their max capabilities at every moment of the day completing the records department research and his core suppression if you're feeling real spicy then restarting from scratch to construct your own personal army of roided up psychopaths to bonk all your problems away at a moment's notice. once you understand this absolute truth you'll realize that lobotomy corporation is actually an easy game and the only reason people say it's hard is because the tutorial is obscure enough you don't know what you're doing half the time you've no way of telling if the work you're doing is actually training your employees properly unless you download a mod for that and because the majority of these people are a bunch of pathetic babies who don't understand that to enjoy a game you need to spend the first 80% of the playtime grinding at 2 am hating yourself and everything around you. essentially if you have less than 30 hours in this game your opinion is irrelevant and you need to get off the computer grandpa. yes i understand you need to feed your family but this game has a very deep and complex narrative that absolutely requires the 100 hours of filler inbetween it all and you need to suffer through every second of it. anyway just like most people recommend if the game is that hard for you just mod it. there's a very handy dandy guide here on steam that is actually quite simple and concise to the point in which you'll only spend about 10 minutes setting it up. of course it won't help you it will only make the process much less frustrating. just remember if you use the super agents mod you better lock your windows because oh boy do i feel abnormal tonight. if i'm being at all serious if the ending for the game wasn't so painstakingly difficult to reach i probably would've capped my playtime out at 70 hours but man do i love jumping through hoops. you should do it too! ignore the flames and angry man whipping your behind that's just a feature. anyway i'm shooting for around 160 hours after that i'm gonna assume i've absorbed everything this game has to offer because if there's a secret ending d it probably wasn't worth the extra 40 hour grind anyway. i'll just look the ending up on youtube.  - achievements to brag about - 165 hours in - defeated white night for the first time [without confession] 178 hours in - defeated the red mist

lob corp is a buggy poor optimised mess that is literally designed to have you throw your head against a wall again and again working things out by trial and error until you get a good enough outcome. the real challenge of the game however comes in the late game where the bulk of the gameplay is micromanaging your units so they don't get shredded. it is messy it is aggravating. and at it's worst when the attempts at a day get long enough to surpass an hour of playtime you'll want to pull your hair out when something slips your mind a hour and an half into an attempt and half of your facility instantly dies. the game is merciless the gameplay is a little jank and the later days are completely unforgiving. i don't wish half of the jank in this game on my worst enemy there's no glory to be had here. i wouldn't even consider most of it too difficult but walking on eggshells for an hour straight really builds on the pressure and hammers in each and every mistake you make.  that said it's probably one of my favourite games period for how gripping the setting is and how well the gameplay is integrated into the plot. the light at the end of the tunnel is absolutely worth it the question is whether or not you're willing to sink the time into finishing it. if you don't like real-time management games it isn't for you but if you're alright with the genre i'd recommend giving it a shot and experiencing it for yourself. even if you regret it you'll come out the other side a little more well-rounded than before.  if you do decide to play it i'd recommend touching up on the 10x speed mod the performance mod that fixes the memory leak and the mod that tells you the ordeals for the day at the beginning on nexus mods.

all hell keeps breaking loose for no reason

first of all the price is definitely worth it if you're interested in management simulator type games as my entire playtime is how long it took to beat the game one time.  i loved the premise of being in a facility having to deal with deadly monsters suppressing them and gradually upgrading your employee from working with said monsters. the creativeness and uniqueness each abnormality brings to the table always kept surprising me even the way every character had such an important role to the story and ending of the game even when i would be convinced a certain character wasn't very important i was always proven wrong. the game is a ton of trial and error learning and improving and just a single day in the game can take hours if you chose an abnormality too difficult to deal with currently. another interesting thing about this game is that every facility anyone ever makes will be different there is plenty of different combinations that could be in ones facility for better or for worse. the story is also very amazing and immersive i feel like i'm actually on a mission to finish what carmen started and to finally free everybody from the cycle of pain that is the lobotomy corporation. as i'm a sucker for lore in games this is where i found most of the enjoyment being interested in the story also helps deal with how much of a low point the gameplay eventually reaches.  for the things i dislike about this game the game play will inevitably reach the point where it is essentially spamming working with certain abnormalities just to get your employee's stats up. this is a process that is not fast by any means even on the fastest game speed you also cannot tell if your employee had their stats increased until you end the day so you pretty much have to just guess if you worked enough and sometimes you wont resulting in you having to once again spend more time stat grinding. another issue that's mainly just a petty one is that some abnormalities have certain quirks or conditions that can lead straight to instakills since you wont know about them until they happen once or you get lucky leading to having the restart the day and can be very time consuming if you're decently far into a day. of course the game is meant to be this way and is part of the difficulty and learning that it requires. another issue is that the game can definitely lose its charm once you research most of the abnormalities as a big part of the fun i found with the game was discovering and learning about the new abnormalities instead of just working with the same ones over and over. the gameplay gets pretty repetitive at this point and you will most likely just be more focused on wanting to be finished with the game.   tl;dr the game is worth the price if you're looking for a management simulator or you like scp the game has great story and is very immersive. the game has plenty of gameplay taking days to finish the game once the gameplay gets repetitive though later on [i]lobotomy corporation[/i] is one of those increasingly common experiences that i could characterize as the 'save scummer's roguelike' alongside the likes of [i]fear & hunger[/i] and [i]pathologic 2[/i].  these are all games where the actual skill/gameplay elements are fairly minimal and instead the player is treated to a gauntlet of meaningful choices‚Ñ¢ the results of which could determine whether you get stuck in an inescapable fail state 4 hours of wasted gameplay later. in these kinds of games the player's primary resource economy is accrued [b]knowledge[/b] over repetition: through subsequent and seemingly arbitrary failures the player is equipped with hundreds of things [i]not[/i] to do and so is steadily shepherded into making the correct choices to move further and further each time.  whether this game will vibe with you or not is already probably clear to you based on what kind of gamer you are. i've been increasingly falling out of love with this kind of experience myself due to market over-saturation and the growing sense that they're intentional wastes of my time but i'm still giving [i]lobotomy corporation[/i] a thumbs-up of my two available choices since i think it's a bit more transparent about what it demands of you than some of these other 'timewasting failure'-type games.  consider this thumbs up maybe 51% to 55% of a recommendation.   [h1]what is lobotomy corporation?[/h1]  [i]lobotomy corporation[/i] is 'vibe' or 'ethos' aside a facility management simulator with control elements from a rts title. the facility in question is the titular lobotomy corporation a sprawling prison for eldritch and supernatural threats. if you're familiar at all with [i]the scp project[/i] you should be recognizing the scp foundation and that's not an accident. the game is [b]very[/b] blatantly a [i]scp[/i] riff albeit with a heavily -- how do i put this -- manhwa webtoon presentation complete with [i]madoka magica[/i]-styled magical girl outfits for your little employees and a poorly-translated jargon-filled misery-porn storyline that takes itself way way too seriously.  coming at the game as an american player the game's overwrought melodramatic daytime-tv storyline cutesy art style and heavy reliance on clicky micromanagement strike as extraordinarily 'korean' but this foreignness to my own sensibilities accentuated rather than detracted from the core hook of the game: its mysteries.  every 'day' that passes in [i]lobotomy corporation[/i] the player is given a choice of three new monsters to add to their facility. initially the player has absolutely no knowledge of the monster up to and including what they even look like. employees then have to 'work' with the monsters in your facility in one of four color-coded interaction options not unlike a hasbro bop-it‚Ñ¢.  do this a requisite amount of times to fill up a power meter. when the power meter is filled the day ends although if you're feeling risky you may instruct your employees to keep playing bop-it‚Ñ¢ indefinitely afterwards because it will make them progressively better at pressing the associated colored button in the future.  however each monster has some kind of gimmick or frequently multiple gimmicks that will cause them to do terrible things to your little employees if you don't know the warning signs. most commonly the monster will break out and start killing people if the wrong bop-it‚Ñ¢ button color is pressed. however some of these gimmicks are considerably more esoteric like a monster that gets jealous whenever any other monster is worked with and so you have to keep working with it to mollify it or a monster that turns the employee working with it hostile and so you need secondary guards around to then pacify that employee.  at first these will seem completely arbitrary to the player; as arbitrary indeed as playing bop-it‚Ñ¢. as the game goes on though the player will accrue the knowledge of what to do and what not to do for each monster while the monster gimmicks get exponentially more complex and the gradually-increasing dozens of monsters in the facility make every subsequent day more heavily micromanaged. near the end of a single run of [i]lobotomy corporation[/i] (about 60-100 hours terrifyingly) the game resembles [i]starcraft[/i] more than [i]prison simulator[/i] with the player feverishly hotbuttoning around and rapidly clicking to put out dozens of fires personally ordering every single one of dozens of employees because there's no automation features.  on the surface this game is the absolute biggest waste of time i could ever recommend to you. a roguelike-styled game that takes 100 hours to complete? and you restart everything if you lose the facility? twodee are you [i]high[/i]?  well the game's rewind system cleverly salvages this.  [h1]rewind rewind rewind[/h1] unlike your typical go back to start with nothing roguelike game loop [i]lobotomy corporation[/i] gives the player the ability to rewind several days back a welcome reprieve if you drafted the wrong monster and it wrecked your facility. it also has the standard 'go all the way back to the start' option although curiously both this and the several-day rewind can be initiated at [b]any[/b] time and not just after losing the facility.  this is because although both options remove your monsters and kill off your employees you [b]keep[/b] everything else: facility upgrades purchased gear for your employees and -- most crucially -- knowledge of what each monster does. the game seems designed around the [i]strong[/i] intent that you'll revert the entire save file at least once: several permanent facility upgrades are locked behind devastating boss encounters that can gut your staff and put you in a poor position to go on and win the game and two of those boss battles late in the game are mutually-exclusive meaning two playthroughs to the endgame are necessary to obtain both associated facility upgrades.  on the second and third and fourth and so on run of [i]lobotomy corporation[/i] the player can breeze through the early levels accruing power freely like how a new game plus works in most conventional rpgs.  this puts the player in a better position for the endgame and each subsequent reset allows the player to accrue more stuff more skills more [i]monster facts[/i]. it's a deceptively forgiving system for this kind of unforgiving game giving the player a massive and potentially game-winning consolation prize for the pain of having to restart everything.  this does return us to the biggest problem of [i]lobotomy corporation[/i] though: it really wastes your time. by the time you're factoring progressive restarts into your power-building strategy to eventually take on the crushingly-difficult endgame you've sunk hundreds of hours into this facility micromanagement sim and are just ready for it to be over. there's light at the end of the tunnel but it's a hundred miles away like a speck on  a black horizon.  i didn't have the endurance to finally power through and finish [i]lobotomy corporation[/i] even if i enjoyed the process of discovery. maybe you can incorporate this knowledge into your run and win where i didn't have the patience to.  [h1]in conclusion[/h1] [i]lobotomy corporation[/i] is an extremely korean facility management roguelike about putting frilly tutus on the [i]scp foundation[/i]. it does not respect your time at all but it at least has the good sense to do some fun things with all of the time it steals like your clingy friend who likes to drink. although the gameplay itself is not particularly engaging the process of discovery is and the game puts a cushion on its sharp 'losing is fun' design philosophy by giving you some nice perks [i]for[/i] losing.  if a little bit of masochism and a lot of time investment sounds great to you right now then i can wholeheartedly recommend [i]lobotomy corporation[/i].

i like this game. i really do. i've nearly gotten one of the game's endings. i'm so close. but before i finish this game i need to get this off my chest. this game is a fucking nightmare. it is from hell. this game is an agonizing slog that will take years off your life because you realize 20 hours into your run you cant do the boss fights because of an abnormality you picked 15 hours ago. it is a massive grind. it is soul crushing and agonizing and miserable and stressful and hateful and starts to require an ungodly amount of micromanaging to clear certain threats. the core gameplay loop stops being difficult and becomes extremely repetitive especially if you picked up abnormalities like magic girl or ticket to hell that force you to constantly micromanage some malarkey and when you're zerging a tough anomaly every healthbar stacks on top of itself and you cant tell if someone's low so you have to get the stacking healthbar mod it's mandatory and while you're at it get the detailed statistics mod because very high high common low and very low are terrible denominators once you find out that an abnormality's response to two different interactions can be rated high but that's a 15-20% difference which is extremely important if you have an abnormality that only wants a very specific result.  this game is very micro-management heavy but it is almost completely lacking in any form of meaningful automation tools. that means you have to keep re-assigning agents to abnormalities you have to keep an agent in every hallway prior to a red dawn ordeal and while there are abnormalities which punish repeated assignments the overwhelming majority of abnormalities can safely be spammed with the same approach by the same agent ad nauseum. while waw and aleph abnormalities punish overuse by decreasing success rates and for some of them it's severe enough to force you to stop using them but a lot of them can be safely milked for all they're worth as the qliphoth meltdown resets their exhaustion. this forces the player to utilize a wide array of abnormalities to consistently make quota because with each meltdown  the game gives you a chance for a free go at one of your most lucrative abnormalities or a forced interaction with an abnormality that poses a significant risk to your agents or the facility as a whole. unfortunately with the game's meta progression the qliphoth meltdown gets nerfed significantly to the point where it removes a lot of the fun decision making and it also drags out each day's run time because you're not getting the surplus of energy that meltdowns trigger. meeting the quota is never a struggle. the real challenge is when the game wants you to make it to a certain level of qliphoth meltdown with two of the game's quests involving you taking on a midnight ordeal which are very challenging fights that are very punishing that if you screw up bad enough can send you back 20-30 minutes.  but i really like this game. it's really really compelling. the setting is really unique despite wearing its inspirations on its sleeve and the worldbuilding is always incredibly intriguing and makes you desperate for the rare glimpses you get into the outside world as you unravel a horrifying sisyphean loop that is sustained by blood and tears. it's also the only scp management type game i can think of and for all of the problems i have with this game it has provided me with an experience completely unlike any other game i've played for better and for worse. i am very excited to be able to move on to the rest of project moon's catalog because they all take place in the same world and i'm desperate to dive more into this setting but i want them to one day try this scp management formula again because there are so many different directions to take this concept there are so many improvements to be made there could be a passionate modding scene if there was a toolkit available to this fanbase i really want to one day see a redo of this game with all of the budget and experience that project moon has gained on full display.

[h1]lobotomy corporation[/h1]  while normaly i would write an entire essay talking about this game i'll just say the best things about it. as of writing of this review i just saw the epilogue and oh boy i can say that the [b]story[/b] of this game is a masterpiece better than most movies you see in the cinema. just getting to know more about the corporation and the world made me do harder things just to see more of the lore. not only the characters have lots of backstory but every single abnormality have their own story.  story is 10/10  now [b]gameplay[/b]. while i normaly don't play any management games (deffinetly not because i'm bad at them) lobotomy corporation managed to make every day fun. now here is a very important part: [u]this game is hard[/u]. this will make lot's of people stop playing but for me it was a motivation because nowadays every game seems to be too easy or just not fun to play. so yeah keep this in mind.  and last but not least - [b]music[/b]. it's amazing idk how they managed to do that but every track is beautiful some even hitting harder than it should. even when you'll hear some track only for 1 day they made it a complete banger.  [hr][/hr] if you're not scared of the difficulty you must try this game. and if you don't want then watch it on yt because the story is too good to just miss out on it because is too hard for you. as the finall [b]tip[/b]: do not get the train. i had a luck that i didn't get it in my first gameplay but i know that it makes most people restart entire runs to day 1. and also be wary of a doctor from old days because he isn't what he seems to be.

if you're reading this you likely already know what you're getting into but in case you don't well...  lobotomy corporation is a game about failure. you will fail. repeatedly. you will have to do days over and over again. sometimes even weeks over again. and eventually most people will need to restart from day 1.  but that's fine. this game isn't exactly fair. but it's still pretty fun if you like to manage stuff.  with all that out of the way now i'd like to discuss the mechanics story art and other things like that. the actual mechanics of the game are pretty simple - click on work to do. find out if it's good or not learn about that thing repeat. occasionally die or kill things by sending people after it. pretty simple but alot of trial and error and alot of repetition. the story is pretty nice - i've not finished the actual true ending yet but i know of its existence. i don't want to touch on it too much as it's very spoiler heavy but i think it's a neat world and the other games in the series expand on it. personally i love the artwork in this game. i love how it is contrasted with the darker tone of the game as well as the violent deaths your agents will be having. i also quite enjoy the sections in the game where the art changes to be more realistic rather than cartoon like. overall i think it's good. the balance is pretty bad both in and out of the players favor. some abnormalities feel way too strong for their class while others feel basically like a non-issue for how dangerous they are considered. but at the same time the magic missile rifle exists and it really funny. but being more serious basically any abnormality that deals pale damage early in the game is quite strong and should be avoided at least until you get a few high level employees (judgement bird destroyed me when i first got it and since then i've been scared of pale damage). some abnormalities are also not difficult but rather annoying such as plague doctor as it constantly moves around. as far as i'm aware there's only one other abnormality that moves around however. don't touch me also exists and should be interacted with frequently as it's incredibly funny.  all in all if you've read all that i take it you're already knowledgeable enough or have a decent enough interest in this game. in either case best of luck managers. you've got some pe boxes to generate.

to date lobotomy corporation is the first game i've ever played to have:  -given me multiple lesbian panic attacks -given me multiple actual panic attacks -has made me write entire essays worth of contingencies strategies and game plans for a single ingame day -has repeatedly sucker punched me after i dare think the thought surely it can't get worse than this -has made me laugh cry and stare blankly at my screen in terror and concern -has kept me up at night way more times than i care to admit  storywise it's one of the best games i've ever played for the characterization and worldbuilding alone but in terms of gameplay it's a spaghetticoded laggy nightmare. i would not recommend playing it without casual and optimization mods as the second half of the game can become extremely grindy and punishing (and the memory leaks tend to make certain missions extremely aggravating.)  also don't try to 100% the seed of light in your very first blind run. not even out of spite. i've lost so much of my lifespan to this game due to my own hubris and i'd never wish it upon my worst enemy. cool monsters though!

lobotomy corporation is a management game in which you must send your employees to work with abnormalities which can be not just monsters but also strange beings objects or even phenomena. working with them generates energy and your goal is to meet a daily energy quota to finish a day and advance to the next.  the game's strongest aspect is its very unique atmosphere. there's a very wide variety of bizarre entities ranging all the way from the weird and funny to the incomprehensible and nightmarish each one with its own lore that you gradually unlock as you work with them. the game has a very mysterious and ominous vibe to it and an intriguing story that'll always keep you wondering what's next. on top of that the soundtrack is also great; there aren't many songs overall but those that the game does have are quite memorable and fit the dark bizarre atmosphere very well.  each abnormality is unique and has its own set of guidelines that you'll slowly uncover as you work with it and you'll learn the most effective ways to deal with each abormality and how to avoid your employees dying a horrible (perma)death when working with them. however the game lets you retry each day as many times as you want so you have an infinite supply of time to figure things out and master the game.  as you work with abnormalities you also unlock extra equipment for your employees: first there's armor that not just helps protect them when an abnormality breaches and must be suppressed but it also protects them during the work itself as the simple act of working with an abnormality already deals damage. second there are weapons that help you suppress breaching abnormalities and other enemies that occasionally appear. third there are gifts little items that give each employee a small bonus in certain stats. therefore the game encourages you to work with all abnormalities and unlock all equipment associated with them. however you need to be careful because if an employee dies you lose their equipment and must get it again.  due to its high difficulty the game has some systems that help you grow stronger and more prepared for the endgame. namely if you restart the story mode you actually keep all the equipment you got and also all the information you've gathered on abnormalities as well as any general upgrades you've unlocked. therefore it's a good idea to occasionally restart the game because you'll be stronger each time and it never feels like grinding because there are so many different abnormalities to discover and it's impossible to see all of them in a single run. so every new restart feels fresh and fun especially as you become more experienced and manage to beat the first few days more easily.  all in all lobotomy corporation is a very unique game with an amazing atmosphere and engaging gameplay and it presents you with a tough but fun and rewarding challenge. it'll pull you into its bizarre intriguing world and keep you coming back to learn more and master it.

a high quality game with such a steep difficulty curve that you will likely be barely able to get past day 7 on your first attempt. out of 50. however as a wise man once said adapt and overcome. if you are looking for a easygoing and slow game first of all why are you looking at a project moon game and second this is definitely not for you. but if you want difficulty suffering the level of rage where you want to grab a sledgehammer and absolutely destroy your computer this may be the right game for you. also just a few warnings:  1. if i didn't make it clear already this game is hard 2. clearing every mission of a department is helpful but also will produce a new challenge  later on unless you are already past the point i'm referring to when i say later on (i cant remember which day) 3. if multiple abnormalities seem to share a common theme it probably means they affect each other or have a special effect when you have all of them (i'm talking about you birds (also yeah watch out for the birds. and unless you want to do a memory repository don't let all 3 escape at once)) 4.employees are super easy to kill so make sure you stock up. 5. some work types will have a special effect when its used on a certain abnormality and its usually a negative effect. so yeah watch out.  anyways i hope you enjoyed this review of lobotomy corporation. the game that will make you want to actually get a lobotomy due to the suffering this game causes

this game is extremely varying in its enjoyability ranging from being pretty fun micromanagement to straight up masochistic mainly due to the abnormalities you get. a few of the final days are complete garbage regardless of what you have though. i think generally you'll have more fun than not but when you get a bad pick it may ruin your entire run alongside your mood (for a bit). i had to do a 2nd run in order to beat the game and when i originally was forced to restart my original one it was due to the fact that i had about one of the worst facilities you could have [b]and then[/b] got a specific abnormality that made it impossible for me to beat the day i was on. in case you're curious it was [spoiler]whitenight on day 16 alongside army in black which i got the day before; i was unable to manage either of them.[/spoiler] anyway i obviously wasn't very happy. in fact i dropped this game for about a week after that because my interest in it temporarily dropped to 0 after getting fucked over that much.   however my 2nd run is the reason why i still recommend this game regardless. i had a [b]ton[/b] more fun with it compared to my previous one partially due to how i decided to treat abnormality picking. i streamed the game to friends (who have played the game themselves) mainly for fun and whenever it came time to pick an abnormality i asked them which ones to avoid choosing just in case there happened to be any at all. then i selected whichever one seemed the most interesting to me from the vague descriptions in-game out of the options i had left (unless i could only pick 1 of course lol). as for [spoiler]the tool abnormalities[/spoiler] i searched up what they did and picked for myself. that's just how i chose to enjoy the game and while i don't think anyone necessarily needs to do something like this to have fun it really helps if you are afraid of getting unlucky [b]especially[/b] if it has happened before to you like in my case. also i would recommend to anyone playing the game for the first time to immediately download the more detailed info mod at the very least. it has qol changes that very much should be in the vanilla game.  with all that aside lobotomy corporation is worth a shot. it's definitely one of those games that clearly isn't for some people but i still think anyone should try it out because it has a lot of charm to it that may interest you enough to like the game even if you aren't normally into micromanagement games of its type. in my opinion if you aren't having fun by at most day 15 then it's likely not for you. if you are into it though good luck. this is definitely not an easy game. i almost wanted to quit a few times and just watch the rest of the story on youtube because some of these days were not very fun at all (only a few but they suck).

cw/tw-- discussion of [spoiler]  suicide self harm drug addiction [/spoiler]  this hidden gem offers a unique and interesting world and gameplay that kept me invested enough to do a full playthrough despite the game's steep learning curve and difficulty.   for pros i would say that the visual style gameplay loop horror elements and interesting post-apocalyptic world were very fun and kept me very engaged. the game is very scp containment breach meets management sim which is something i haven't seen done  before.   that being said there are definitely some real negative things about the game. the most striking thing to me was the lack of trigger warnings for the shock content in the game. to be very frank i would not recommend playing this game if you are sensitive to topics of [spoiler] suicide and self harm. [/spoiler] the way that the game handles these topics is very insensitive and poorly handled. [spoiler] suicide [/spoiler] is a massive focus of the game's story and is shown in graphic detail in several different ways- even in the gameplay itself. there are also items in game that make very insensitive remarks to [spoiler] self harm [/spoiler] which made me very uncomfortable.   this game features many different types of horror in the stories of it's various monsters- from slasher-type monsters to purely psychological-horror inspired entities- but for every unique interesting and familiar take on horror one might also find something done just for shock value which i think takes away from the experience. if you love shock horror and don't care about the game's insensitive handling of topics of mental health [spoiler] suicide self harm and drug addiction [/spoiler] (perhaps if those things just don't bother you) i would recommend the game.   another quick thing to mention is that i would not recommend this game at all if you are looking for a casual gameplay experience. this game is incredibly difficult- and without the heavy use of a wiki will result in many many failed runs before you will likely be able to get too far. the difficulty spike as you progress is a straight-up vertical wall and the game does not hand-hold you with tutorials. it can be very difficult to understand and learn if you haven't played before.   overall i would recommend lobotomy corporation but please remember to be safe when dealing with the  triggering topics and content of the game as i do not believe the game properly warns the viewer of the sensitive topics that it fumbles around with constantly and could cause significant discomfort in the wrong person.

even if you think you will not enjoy a stressful game like this somehow it's still extremely fun. too bad i am late to the party. (i do not like gacha games)  i'd suggest you play blind to really experience it all for yourself. this game is awesome. the music completes it all. the monotonous tasks of your day-to-day management are accompanied by the same song the music growing dynamically as you complete more and more of your task. special events are accompanied by their own tracks. i have not felt such powerful emotion from music and gameplay like this combined. the main song accompanying all of the days really helps to make the other tracks feel special. the difficulty definitely bites though it will feel well worth it once you accomplish the challenge. i'd been wanting to play this game for a few years now and i regret not having done it sooner. do not let the same regret consume you.  thanks for giving me the chance to play this perish.

[h1] this review contains no-spoilers tl;dr at the bottom [/h1]   lobotomy corporation is one of the most fun games i have ever played its also one of the hardest that difficult tag is not lying during your first play through you will have to restart the week that being you lost a lot of employees or you got an abnormality that is too difficult to contain your first play through will have at least one restart (and that's where i find some of the charm of this game) so this is a basic review for someone who has stubble onto this hidden gem of a game  [h1] whats the premise of the game? [/h1]  this is a tycoon/manger simulator that is based of the scp foundation each day you get a new abnormality varying in difficulty to competed a day you need to work on abnormality (4 types of work some are better than others on certain abnormality) to get enough e-box to pass the day using said e-box can be researched to discover more about the abnormality and its habits or use to acquire armour and weapons with some armour/weapons being able to deal more damage/take more damage while doing less/being vulnerable to other there are several other cogs that make this game work that im not getting into if you want a new-player guide/you are expecting a new player guide this isn't it (i might do one if this review goes well)  [h1] whats the story of the game? [/h1]  (without getting into spoiler territory) a basic intro into this game you are the new manager of lobotomy corporation a company that uses ais and employees to farm abnormalitys for their energy your new job is to insure nothing goes to shit i could explain more but this is a story that's better if you don't know anything going into it  [h1] should i get it? (rating) [/h1]  absolutely although i complain in the beginning that the game is rage inducing pretty much all of the time it was your fault you didn't read something correctly you didn't suppress that threat immediately you were lazy and didn't check all the abnormalitys for danger and for that and  [*] a great sound track  [*] amazing visuals  [*] a good game play loop  [*] creative and unique designs  [*] and unique remixes of already created characters (fairy tales)  lobotomy corporation is a 9/10   tl;dr: lobotomy corporation is a very fun but rage inducing game that i think alot people should try

this game is good if you like management and high difficulty games. you will need patience especially when you're trying to figure out what is each abnormality and their method of management. the game can be easy but you won't get the proper ending. and if you try to get the proper ending... expect getting wiped several times. good thing is even if you lose all your employees you can still succeed with a new batch although harder. although you can retry the day or relapse to an earlier memory if you find yourself stuck.  the story is interesting and this game has two sequels now one is a tbs (library of ruina) and the other is a tbs gacha (limbus company)

originally i thought i was going to dislike this game and truthfully i did! however after progressing further in the game i realized: holy moly wait this game is actually so good  it has the perfect amount of lore to keep you interested and keep you progressing through days the perfect amount of gameplay - both strategically and difficulty wise - and learning all these new abnormalities and what they do is a great feeling. sitting there with the game paused for minutes on end just thinking of what to do in order for your agents to not die a brutal death is a wonderful feeling and the stress gained? it's such a great feeling as well.  overall while lobotomy corp may not be for everyone it's definitely a game worth checking out if you're a fan of the scp foundation or just a fan of strategic games like civilization or fallout shelter.

i would recommend this game to anyone. it broke me. it rebuilt me. i'm ashamed of what i became when i played this game yet never before have i gained such power. no one is meant to play the game the way i played it. i should have reset to day one the moment i got d-01-106 at day 12 as noon or dusk events would inevitably kill clerks which would inevitably release the bitch who would then kill everyone. we were too weak then to fight back.  and and yet somehow i persisted. i ascended. i rushed execution bullets. starting waiting for clerks to overlap so i could take out 3 or so at once. would spend the first few qliphoth levels spamming bullets just so i could clear out all the clerks. once they were gone then the true day could begin. by day 35 i had trauma-bonded with my nuggets and refused to let any of them die and we were past fearing what a mere army could do. memory reposited more times i could count in order to 100% the abno records without having to do a full reset and to do the boss missions without losing an employee. it was madness. it was unhealthy. i should have just let them all die.  what did i do it for? what hollow satisfaction? when i spent two hours in the winning attempt battling t-03-46 with a single surviving employee i knew in my heart that once this challenge was conquered there was nothing left but to reposit one last time and then finally take on the end game. by god i did it. but i was empty. what left did i have to live for?  my friend told me there was a sequel. with tears in my eyes i realised maybe it didn't have to be the end.  but then as i examined the steam store page horror filled me greater than hearing the popping buzz of a bee or the drop of second trumpet ever could greater than hearing i love you repeating in an eerie childish timbre.   the sequel is a card game.  :(  otherwise game is amazing 12/10 do give it a try!!! there really is nothing like it <3

playing this game is like getting hired for a job you think you're qualified for and for the first few days that holds true  but then more and more convoluted bullshit is expected of you and while you may one day master all of your responsibilities today is not that day or tomorrow or next week or next month.

the real lobotomy was the loops we had along the way...  one must imagine x happy  edit: im not really good with making serious reviews but ill try just this once for this game.   despite everything it made me went through this game is one of my favorites. the days may be rough and challenging but each time i got access to a piece of the lore by completing them to figure out what is going on in this place i felt pretty good. mostly everything included in the game is canon to the universethe ordeals forshadow the future the abnormalities are all unique with their own cool designs and mechanics that will make you either love them or hate them. this game also have a banger responsive ost when things dont go your way. its a management game and things will go south pretty quickly if you dont pay attention to the abnormalities in your facility. every choice you will make is going to be bad and thats on you its how you weight them with your experiences through the loops that will make you a better manager.  personally what i love the most is that the whole point of the game is trying to make things right. as you continue your grind toward the end of the game and develop each departements to get to the next layer you get to learn more about the sephiraths. they are in a way your assistants as well as being your tormentors. their traumas and guilt will be redirected toward you and you will have to overcome them in special events that you can trigger when you feel ready for it called : core suppresions. they can range from pretty fun once you get the gist of it to extremely painful but despite that really enjoy the sort of bond that you can make with them as they finally come to their own realization and change their point of view to hope toward another future.  even though all of this may sound great its a pretty hard game to recommend. all of project moon games have a difficulty spike and this one will test your patience as you will make mistakes because of your lack of knowledge. you will have to restart either the day the facility or memory rep a lot of times to make it through the end. for that i recommend using mods to better the quality of life like chesed fixed if you are able to make it to that departement perma agent but mostly the one that allows you to see the stats percentage of each work types (i always forget that mod name sorry). it wont spare you from the suffering that this game brings but it should at least alleviate the pain a little bit. after all this facility is your own prison and you will have to discover the point of all of this by yourself(or with the wiki if you dont feel like it lol).  i recommend that you get this game on sale you may like it you may hate it or perhaps you may persevere and come to love it. i wish that you give this game a chance as well as other ones. project moon are really great with their story telling and i only wish that you enjoy their universe as much as their fan do.  with this i wish you all best of luck if you do pick it up. (if i made grammar mistakes i apologize ive been up for more than 24 hours)
