overview: lobotomy corporation is a simulation management game that works closely with the horror concept of 'the unknown'. it is not a horror game designed to scare the player directly but to make them doubt themselves while forcing them to make difficult decisions. you the player are introduced to the world as a senior manager of the lobotomy corporation's power generation facility. your job is to hire assign direct and manage the fundamental aspects of various departments and the abnormalities within them. abnormalities are creatures and objects that when 'worked' on generate a limitless supply of energy. that energy then gets used to power the depressing undercity around which the corporation was built. coupled with an overarching plot and a desire to know more this game is unique enough to hook new players and engaging enough to keep them going to the end.  the abnormalities are the focal point of the setting and the gameplay. they're the 'fun' factor that many other games in the genre fail to supply. if you read any of the reviews a few pages down you'll probably see a lot of people referencing some obscure bit of information relating to one of the 110 (at the time of writing) [i]things[/i] you can encounter as part of the abnormality system. most of them are creepy or terrifying but they all share a theme of [b]wonder[/b]. each day in-game you pick one or more abnormalities to add to your facility with only two pieces of information:  1.) a serial number containing letters numbers and dashes 2.) a quote from their document.  that's all. you're not even shown what the abnormality looks like or given any clue as to how dangerous it might be. you pick a containment unit and start your day hoping that it doesn't end in a bloodbath. and that's the beauty of this game. it will always give you just enough information to keep you asking for more like a drip feed in an iv. aside from that you manage employees facility upgrades and equipment research to help you deal with the less tolerant residents under your care.   your employees will die. they will die a lot and often in ways you can't predict. you'll sometimes get an abnormality you can't deal with and have to restart from day 1 in the hopes that the next time you get it you'll have the knowledge or equipment to deal with it the next time. that is the appeal of lobotomy corporation. the visual novel is just a bit of icing around the edges. i'm writing this review in preparation for the sequel library of ruina which is supposedly going to be released this year.  pros: + engaging story with interesting characters + 'real' horror that doesn't rely on jump-scares or fancy vfx + 'rogue-lite' options that allow you to fix your mistakes + deep lore that is never fully explained to the player + plenty of tributes to scp foundation and its writers + good replayability  cons: - poor translation (see footnote) - slow tutorial (you'll need it) - easy to give up (losing your whole workforce at once) - slow/no updates (there's still a list of unreleased abnormalities)  translation notes - the game's translation was meant to be much better than it currently is. for the most part the game is about 90% legible. many of the passages contained in abnormality documents are difficult to wrap your head around without re-reading them. common mistakes include leaving out an abnormality's name in the unlockable hints and overall poorly structured sentences. if you can look past the engrish still quite engaging. project moon hired a company with about a dozen 'professionals' to do the job. apparently those professionals don't know how to translate korean to english. see this thread for more information: https://steamcommunity.com/app/568220/discussions/0/3211505894124567606/

this game is pretty fun. gameplay: you guys into that scp stuff? well this game is just for you. in this game you manage [strike] scps [/strike] anomalies to gain energy. that's it. but there's more! woah there's more?! of course there is you spastic monkey. when you find an anomaly you know nothing about it so working with it is a risky guess work of a multiple choice test. if you guess correctly you can us points (p.e. boxes) to unlock information about you're little monster which is vital to the survival of your employees and the integrity of your sanity. some anomalies aren't monsters but rather machines that works differently than the rest. regardless trial and error is key. also this game is pretty hard. expect things to go ape every once in a while so get that retry button handy if you think things aren't going right for you. if you wanna do an iron man run (no retries) i commend you. however despite the difficulty the game is really good. visuals: the anomalies employees and you're friendly ais are done in a cartoon fashion much like an anime but korean. unlike the scp corporation visuals the artwork in this game is a stark contrast between what the contents of the game presents but it's very nice to look at. there is even an in-game explanation into why the game looks the way it is and i liked it's reasoning.  soundtrack and other sound related things: the game when you're just cruising through with nothing going ape yet has a beautiful ambience to it. when things starts happening and you're rabid dog breaks out of it's rusty kennel the soundtrack turns to a more techno-like music festival as you bang your head while you're employees starts to panic and die off because they didn't take their rabies medication in time and the other's couldn't put down that rabid monstrosity. also if you pay attention enough a lot (perhaps all) of the anomalies makes their own unique sounds and it really adds to their mysterious character.  other: a game without flaws is a game that doesn't believe in a thing called updates. however this game does have its flaws. i never encountered any bugs myself but i have read many other reviews that talked about bugs so be wary of those. there are some translating errors with my favorite being i've just noticed that a certain employee filled their water bottle with bear and drank it at work. like comment the mistake and subscribe for a free gift card giveaway. however this doesn't sway me away from the game and it's atmosphere. this is my personal nitpick but despite there being a new game choice the research you gained from the previous games carries over so you can get pretty far ahead if you manage to pick up those anomalies again. despite my complaints i understand this approach because you the gamer should know about the anomaly if you start fresh so just give them the things they know.  i give this game a 10 panicking employees / a meat lantern eating all of them because they don't have a sense of caution thoroughly recommend it go play it.

i've been having a good time with lobotomy corporation so far. the game features very experimental gameplay performing work on various anomalies to extract energy to meet daily quotas while also finding out about their risks the most effective approach to work and sometimes it's potential uses. it's about avoiding disaster and minimising casualties and handling the inevitable emergencies.  i had to rewrite this paragraph because i didn't fully understand how the rogue lite progression works but it's actually really clever. you can reset a day if things go south so at first it seems that the whole rouge lite aspect would only be useful if you start a day that you couldn't possibly finish however resetting to day 1 allows you to keep many bonuses such as equipment and facility upgrades. the true ending requires difficult events to be completed which offer valuable facility upgrades followed by extremely hard challenges on the final days. resetting from day 1 allows you to build a greater staff base and identify problematic or desirable abnormalities before selecting them. this in turn allows you to overcome challenges you where ill-equipped to face before due to setbacks from previous events or poor choices.  i'd say it is worth checking out the story is really good but is very separate from the abnormalities contrary to what makes the scp articles so engrossing but there are a few interesting abnormality stories here and there and the real strength are the gameplay mechanics of the abnormalities.

after playing the game for nearly 100 hours within 2 months i can very safely say that i'd recommend buying the game if you like games where you manage various things.  [h1] the gameplay [/h1] you have a team of employees that you hire with lob points. you order your employees to do work on the abnormalities and each one of the abnormalities favors one or two work action over the others. depending oh how much they like the work you'll get a good neutral or bad result with each abnormality reacting differently. the better the work result the more energy you produce. you have to meet an ever-growing energy quota to complete the days. [spoiler] at some points in the game you're given the option to do 'boss battles' called sephira meltdowns most of which put a special effect on your or your employees for that day. [/spoiler]  [h1] the story [/h1] do you like being confused? do you like a myriad of random terms being thrown at you through the poorly-translated dialogue of ai robots? then this game is definitely for you. if not then it's surely easy to glance past the story and still enjoy the game.  [h1] the soundtrack [/h1] huge shoutouts to tilarids and the other artists as well as the devs who did the soundtrack for lobotomy. there are plenty of awesome techno-rock songs in the game for the player to enjoy [spoiler] especially for the sephira meltdowns [/spoiler]  in conclusion i personally believe that this game exceeds in its goal to be a monster management simulator. aside from the occasional bug the experience is almost always smooth. just hope you don't get an aleph too early in the game.
love the game and enjoyed every second of it. also rip birds

i will say it is not a tycoon like it says it is. you get very little choice in how to expand or what parts you expand. but it is definitely a management game. every day consists of you getting a increasing amount of pe-boxes from researching the various monsters you hold. once you get enough pe-boxes the day ends. but its not that simple you also have to deal with raids breakouts and whatever else go's wrong. and trust me something will go wrong.  i think that perhaps the best aspect of this game is the way it scares you. while the artstyle and some of the monsters are less then scary. the real horror comes from you as the manager having to poke and prod these monsters to figure out what the hell they do. and you cant just ignore them or else they'll escape potentially causing mass havoc. this leads to the decision of risking a employees life or playing the lottery and hoping its a non-escapable object which cant escape.  luckily the game allows you to redo a day with no consequences if you completely mess up meaning that with time you can learn how to counter these monsters in a single day of work. but the initial fear and stress of what that monster does is more then enough to make you think twice before sending in just anyone on the next monster. while the reward for researching these monsters is pe boxes special gear and the history of these monsters. starting a new game also allows you to get different monsters on different days while keeping all research on previous monsters intact and still having access to their equipment. and you will need to reset atleast once because you'll most likely hit a wall where you cant care for a specific monster and it just destroys the facility everytime you start the day  i do wish monsters had more unique parameters to research them. most of them boil down to sending in a guy with stats catered towards them. overall its a pretty solid management game.

i like the concept and have the game but i would love to see a less cartooney version of this game. an scp like game with human looking guards scientist and others. not a child like visual game. i think if such a game was made maybe lc2 then it would sell like crazy and be considered one of the best made. everyone wants this i hope these guys or someone else does that. imagine real guns and strange tech as they try to contain these things. the only thing that takes away from the game is the visuals.

okay...so...where do i get started? i love this game it reminds me of cabin in the woods and the scp foundation...i wouldn't be surprised if they took inspiration from the scp foundation. now then this game is a management game where you manage abnormalities and gain energy that is one day of work. you start off with easy going abnormalities that normally don't kill your people. eventually...you start to collect creatures that can escape and obliterate your facility. some abnormalities can drive your employees insane leading them to release abnormalities or run around driving others insane. do i suggest this game? hell yeah. it's a fantastic game for those looking for this type of experience. the music is fantastic often fitting the scenario no warning the song that normally plays. fits the calm and unique tone of the game. warning one the song that plays when a abnormality first escapes fits the tone well it makes you feel like you need to prepare. warning two plays when two abnormalities escape sends a sense of urgency to you stating that you better prepare fast. warning three in basic terms...tells you that you are screwed. how much would i rate this game...? a 9/10 the only flaw is translation it's odd but most of the time easy to understand. that is all for my review good day.

instead of describing the pros and cons of this game allow me to instead share a story titled:   how my dad sacrificed himself to save the facility   (to avoid spoiling abnormalities i will refer to each one as a1 a2 etc.)  i was in the process of attempting to clear a mission to recontain 5 waw class abnormalities (the second to highest class) and i only had 2 abnormalities where purposefully releasing and recontaining them was reasonable:   a1 is a waw class abnormality which when released has the ability to teleport randomly across the facility dealing high damage to everyone in the room before each teleport. he's a real pain to contain due to this but i know i can easily recontain him without any casualties if i'm careful. a1 was my main strategy for clearing this mission and it would have been the only strategy if it weren't for:  a2 another waw class who has a special ability which releases him from containment after abnormalities escape 3 times meaning the strategy now was to release a1 twice then realease a less threatening abnormaility so i can take care of a2 rinse and repeat. simple really.  so i go about doing that. i recontain a1 twice a2 once and a1 once more. each time some random clerks (which are employees you can't control and are basically fodder) die but i don't really care cause none of my agents (controllable employees) have died.  now here's where the fun begins. on my fourth and final attempt to recontain a1 he causes the 20th employee to die which just so happens to be the exact condition for the scariest monster i have in my collection a3 (which is an aleph class aka the highest class) to escape... which in term is the 3rd abnormaility to escape causing a2 to escape as well leading the facility to enter emergency level #2. emergency level #2 also just so happens to be the exact condition for another waw class a4  to escape...  i now have four highly dangerous abnormaities roaming the facilty slaughtering all my clerks while i try to salvage my agents all hope is lost this facility under normal conditions is no longer salvageable...  here's where my dad comes in i created a bald agent who i named dad after my dad of course i trained him up to be a level 5 agent and gave him magical girl armor and a magical girl staff to suit. he was also the closest level 5 employee to a5 my ace in the hole my trap card my contingency plan. a5 when activated causes all abnormalities to be recontained automatically. the catch? it can only be used once a day by a level 5 employee and causes their immediate death.  i knew what had to be done time was running short i select my dad and send him to a5 and in a brilliant flash of light all the abnormalities were recontained i completed my mission and my dad was no more.  brilliant game would recommend to anyone who wants to be traumatized by a disappearing father among other things.

objectively the gameplay is meh but as far as i know it is the _only_ scp management simulator in existence so it's the best in it's genre by default.  trying to find similar games on sites like 50gameslike.com gave me bomber crew at #4 fran bow at #6 and doki doki at #11... so if you want an scp management fix this is it.  my criticism of the gameplay aside it does do it's job well.  you will start to see your workers as expendable you will fear how much damage unknown entities will do to you before you have a chance to study them properly and you will resort to lore friendly save scumming when you accidentally sent said entities on a lab wrecking rampage due to a single misclick.    you will need to read a quick start guide written by an english speaker.  you will need to keep written notes to make sure you don't mismanage the finickier abominations.  and never ever forget that save scumming is 100% lore friendly!  you are the director after all!

genuine honest-to-god review of my favorite game since i think i somewhat qualify as an expert:  tldr: game is fun for certain kinds of people but its design flaws are glaring and you have to have a lot of patience to see the good parts that make those flaws worth it. get it on sale though. 4/10 for the average person 10/10 if you're genuinely unhinged like me.  this game simply put is not designed well. it has mechanics that in a vacuum seem interesting and have potential but the way this game is put together becomes frustrating rather than challenging. there are plenty of examples of this happening but i think the most blatant is the abnormality managerial tips which i'll focus on in this review to avoid spoiling any story stuff.  abnormalities (the monsters you're containing in this game) all possess some form of special ability that will activate when certain conditions are met. these range from harmless things like escaping containment and killing some nameless clerks to instantly killing the employee you've spent three hours grinding up to max stats to just outright slaughtering a whole department if you're not far enough into the game to receive tools to deal with them. the intended way to get around this is that there isn't one. whenever you gain a new abnormality you chuck your strongest goon into the meat grinder (sometimes literally) and see what happens until you have all the information necessary or everyone is dead. once this happens you promptly restart the day if the losses are worth more than the time you've spent now armed with the knowledge you've gained.  that sounds fine when put in this way but the real issue comes from the more esoteric abnormalities. sometimes you will receive an abnormality that has abilities so esoteric annoying and unmanageable that you will elect to simply leave it alone and pray qliphoth meltdown (another game mechanic but honestly this one i like) doesn't hit that containment unit. in fact there is a... certain abnormality that everyone just simply knows not to take after their first experience with it. it sucks to manage has many elements of random chance frequently causes unpreventable deaths and if i didn't also add that it was very very loud i'm pretty sure all those characteristics could be applied to quite a few of the abnormalities by most people.  mind you these complaints about the manageability of abnormalities are coming from me someone who has memorized every single preference ability drop and piece of equipment of every single abnormality has put over a thousand hours into a game with very little replay value and knows everything well enough to fully expect anything the game can throw at me. these complaints are not for me they're for jonathan.coolguy.2007 the average joe that got lured into playing this games by one of my fellow basement nerds because this game is as i said poorly designed. if you're not willing to put up with that design don't buy this game. watch someone play it (even badger content creators to play it plaese please please pelae elase leasepl-) because that's much funnier. if however you are willing to put up with bad translation random bullshit beyond your control hot koreans and reading the entire torah to understand the references this game makes then i really do recommend giving it a try though you should wait until it goes on sale to buy. even i know $25 is too much iirc the price is because the original translators totally ripped off the devs.  actually now that i think about it the music slaps so this is a great game 10/10.

this game is amazing! ive been playing it for possibly three years now and it is still one of my favorite games. my favorite part is learning about all the anomalies and figuring out how to keep them contained. i love how creative this team was with all of their creatures. i would definitely recommend this to anyone who loves a good strategy game <3

tell me is it wrong to have faith? we are all sinners and the blue star is the only place that accepts sinners. we will purify our sins there. we all go back to that place someday. it's an instinct. you may think emily who threw herself into the blue star is dead but she only returned to her rightful place. she‚Äôs a martyr. she became an eternal star. the rising of a star means a brand new start. don‚Äôt you hear the sound the everlasting trumpet? when you are close to the star you can hear the welcoming cheers and singing. if we all return back to this place only the blue star will remain. we will meet again as stars.

let me get this out of the way first if you can tolorate or heck like me dont care for semi repetitive gameplay ive played a lot of mmos so im used to it personally. you shouldnt be suprised when you have to reset your run about 4 times to get the best ending in the game due to the bounuses the serephim meltdowns give you. bu if you can move all past that and the bad grammer you should be able to love this game. itll be really hard at first but once youve played for a while or memorised all the abnormalites or both like me at 329 hours. and yes theres a lot of trial and error. especally with the alephs. but  the story and gameplay is based around that. if you simple get nothing thereb efore you have an emplyeee with maxed out stats jsut go back 3 or 2 days using the memory imprint if you get whitenight from plauge doc just press esc and retry the day and boom no ones dead just only use the esc menu for crap otherwise you can lose a lot of ego. now onto the pros and cons and ill end my rant on why you should get this game if you can look past its 2 main flaws   pros: *great and deep stroy even if it fails at the end it really hooks you in first time around and can on later replays as well. *this game is really f**king hard. and the seriphim meltdowns and the final 4 days mainly 49 really test you. but sadly normal days now are to easy and boring  *visuals are great even on medium heck i cant tell a diffrence between medium and high so fps boosts woot. *lots of intresting lore for the abnormalites serpherias and your player char. *once again 329 hours. so yes the game is really fun and i may love it to much due to the replayability it offers even if its a bit lack luster. *the bad grammer can sometimes be tooken out of context and be make about 5x funnier *awsome music.   cons: *bad grammer all over place. can deal with to have fun. but annoying is one way to say it. *repetitive gameplay on the normal days.  probobly the biggest issue *the game may be way to hard for newcomers but it wont be that much of an issue after playing for a while but i feel ya this game can be brutal such as hokma gebura without bluestar shelter the final 4 days binah so yeah it may be way to hard but this is one of the minor issues since you adapt to it fairly quickly *you can brick your save by picking plauge doc on a mem imprint day or hell any aleph early game. thus forcing you to reset your run attempt youll still keep all your ego but have to redo all the normal days u resetted. *awsome music but its only really used in seriphim supressions aside from like 4 tracks 2 of witch youll never hear during a normal day aside from a white night like incident. *repetitive gameplay need i say more? *trial and error and i mean a lot of it *some of the things the supressions limit what you can do so. have fun doing a purple midnight without pausing on 3x speed. *this game is resource intensive my labtop is a 500$ lenovo thinkpad 8 gigs of ram processor is an amd a12-9720p radeon r7 12 compute cores 4c+8g with 2.70 giga hertz and once i unlock the middle layers i can go above 40 fps and 30 for the lower layers and aout 25 for the supressiosns with their effects and this is with razer game booster active and the game set to above normal witch works better than high priority at least in my experience. personally this isnt an issue since i use amd to cap my game at 30 fps since i love 30 more than 60 but i do understand the issue.   and thats about it. im not good at phrasing my words so take everything with a grain of salt and yes while i was born in america my grammer typing wise is terrible. but its still better than this games grammer. anywho this is my reveiw overall i reccomend it if your willing to cut it some slack

manage a company of people trying to make to make energy out of supernatural entities. everything will be fine. every employee or clerk is expendab- i mean important. full of interesting choices  like will you drink the champagne ? will the cactus blossoms ? a b or c? get the birds. enjoy the doctor blessings. pet the dog. praise spookyboi. talk to your grandma. thomas the tank engine. absolutely nice tree. monolith drop from dominion iv. is that painting by gustav klimt ? oh god what the hell is that thing it's made of bodies. tt ate them and now it's going to eatr me ohmahgaaaaad ! and remember :  borb.

incredibly well done scp-style game probably the best scp game we'll ever see in our lifetime unless a miracle happens. this game is 200% filled with soul it's the very definition of a labor of love. if you can get past the ui which takes a little work and the translation which is a bit wacky(but nowhere near as bad as it previously was!) then you'll have a chance to experience this amazing piece of work. really good story too which i didn't expect when they turned the story bits into what i assumed to be an anime girls visual novel. good job honestly.  let us meet again as stars.
interesting management game.

yes. lc taught me pain patience and pleasure.  the awesome: 1. decent story arc 2. best in-game music ever 3. never fails to give you goose bumps 4. nice art and the artwork community is dope  the awful: 1. the english translation (let's be real) 2. repetitive ux in early game 3. defective ui - can't properly select employees to save them from the gnaw of death 4. m e m o r y   l e a k  let's hope that after the release of lor project moon will have more resources to improve the lc experience.
welcome to lobotomy corporation if you are feeling suicidal you've come to the right place.
fortnite and marques brownlee

as a long time fan of the scp foundation i have to say that it sometimes feels easy to become disconnected from the horror inherent in that series. not that the works aren't well-written its just that cosmic/scientific horror is sometimes a hard concept to wrap your mind around. lobotomy corporation rectifies this by essentially putting you in the shoes of a foundation overseer and showing you that terror first hand. every abnormality you receive may a mundane artefact or a world-ending nightmare and there is no way to know aside from poking and prodding it possibly setting off some horrid chain reaction in the process. one false step be it forgetting to check up on that one aggressive monster neglecting the advancement of your agents or simply performing the wrong test could spell disaster. all of this goes alongside an interesting plot with the ais that run the facility with a few twists that genuinely took me by surprise. for any fan of the scp foundation or anyone who just wants to try out a neat roguelite game lobotomy corporation is definitely worth the purchase.
don't trust the dog! don't trust that fucking dog!

very cool game basically scp the game but for once its actually scp the game and not d class simulator my favourite game so far  only negative things i found in game was small number of pale damage weapons and that whore queen of hatred i rate it 11 out of 10 [redacted] and 6 god delusions + d class laurel

lobotomy corporation is the game you want to play if you've ever wanted to manage a facility full of dangerous and unnatural entities forcing your employees to harvest them for energy.   the gameplay itself is mechanically simple but as the the days progress you get more and more moving pieces and must figure out the most efficient way to manage them as a whole. armed without proper knowledge of your abnormalities one breach or careless mistake could cascade into a deadly situation as your crisis management skills are put to the test.   comes packed with an interesting story and characters as well although it suffers from a sub-par english translation.
good

jesus this game is fun.  honestly get this game - it takes some time getting used to but my god is it great.  music's a bit redundant (except the warnings) but i love dealing with the abnormalities and all the other features in the games (spoilers sadly).  can't really give much of a review without spoilers - just play it trust me. it is a good game.
wish there was a version of d class so that i didn't have to throw agents at we can change anything

lobotomy corporation if i had to explain it in a few words: try an iron man run i [b]dare[/b] you. this game has a bit of a slow learning process at the beginning you are slightly overloaded with information and will find some things confusing but after a few days you will understand everything... or at least... you think you will. lobotomy corporation often ends up being more of a challenge because of your lack of understanding with abnormalities.   you can have a completely new abnormality which you think sending someone to do work on it would end up perfect... but instead one of their stats is too high and now they're dead or you have a break out on your hands which causes half of your workforce to panic because you didn't spread out their stat increases and now all of your workforce is either dead or [i]surviving[/i].  all in all lobotomy corporation can be a huge challenge as you get later into the game and every new day brings with it a new and exciting challenge. there are some occasions in which the challenge ends up being more of a roadblock but other than these smaller cases... the game is very enjoyable.  the micromanagement style of gameplay may not be for everyone but you will slowly get used to managing your entire workforce like it was the back of your hand... as long as you don't have a lot of escaped abnormalities that is.  so now that you've braced yourself for the high and lows you are going to experience go and collect some energy manager.
great game good art nice atmosphere   which i can find more game like this

big bird is cute! cute!  actual review: lobcorp's a very fun albeit difficult game about managing employees and talking to various sephirah/sephirot music's a bop story's intriguing (especially with the re-translation update although i will miss [spoiler]great love for us instead of grant us love replacing it[/spoiler] and gameplay is surprisingly simple with a difficulty curve that increases as you progress further make sure to attack any abnormalities even if they're a small bird

honestly a really fun game. it's got really bad localization and it makes it difficult to understand some mechanics at first and difficult to follow the story some times but i fully completed the game and it was a great experience. i would just go ahead an double check things online or if you get stuck look for help online.

a great management game that requires a lot of retries.  each day starts with an energy quota that you'll need to collect from abnormalities. at first its easy but as you progress through the game you'll encounter more and more troublesome abnormalities that may ruin your day along with random events that are designed to provide some additional challenge.  other than that it also has a great story with amazing soundtracks. it is also rather lengthy as with 100 hrs i still haven't finished the story.  note: i highly recommend to play this game completely blind as reading spoilers about the abnormalities and story may dampened your experience.

nothing is as beautiful as the sound it makes when it devours a human. me: i don't like where this is going....  10/10 would have the facility blow up again.  it's a game about learning from mistakes and finding out what the heck these creatures and objects do. normally when you screw up and get your best employees killed it would be frustrating but you can always retry the day so you never stay mad. it's a game where as soon as i began playing i didn't stop for 6 hours you can never stop...

this game is a difficult one to write about it's great has no negative things about it so far and is really challenging so you'll have some fun with it.  [list]     [*]there are a lot of different things to explore some good some bad some literally the end of the world.     [*]the story will make you want to get to the next level no matter what it'll cost.     [*]you can customize the characters yourself to make it perfect for yourself. [/list]  what you shouldn't do tho: [list]     [*]reset if anything goes wrong push forward and keep going a bit of death won't kill you.     [*][strike]push the button.[/strike]     [*]lose your sanity.     [*]not be able to handle multiple things at once.     [*]have something against a lot of things going wrong.     [*]read about it online or let a friend tell you everything the mysterious part is the fun don't let others spoil it for you. [/list]  overall a solid [u]10/10[/u] from me just frustrating if you die a few seconds before you finish the game.

for lower end computers you may encounter game crashing or even bluescreens because this game was created using the unity engine. which apparently has plenty of memory leaks this game itself definitely does over the course of three hours you'll need to reopen the game. it's inconvenient. that aside it's a fun game definitely worth getting on a discount if you like scp stuff the unique monsters you collect over time are fun and the game has a few days worth of content to get through.  it's kind of like dwarf fortress you will lose and you probably should if you want to see just how much of a disaster the containment breach can be.

an update to my very younger selves review this game is incredibly fun and entertaining however it is not for the feint of heart. the horror elements of this game are very much mild compared to others but it still can be unpleasant for those who cannot handle horror. if you don't meet the requirement and love managing games like sims get it. i'm positive you'll enjoy the experience.

a very good game.   it really grows on you the more time you spend with it. i personally really enjoy the fact that you can restart the game back to day 1 and have the option to keep everything (information mission completions equipment) and try again with what you learned. the oddball monster all have their own gimmicks that i find really fun to figure out and some that i have grown to fear.  if you have the patience for a sanity/monster management sim then give it a shot.  edit: forgot to say that the music is really fucking good.

when i bought the game i was scared. i read some reviews and it didn't sound very promising. i got the game nevertheless and i was pleasantly surprised.  i read a lot of reviews that stated that the english translation isn't the best and while i can't say it's great there are times where i totaly forget bad translation is a thing. it feels pretty inconsistent since there are times where the translation is on point. the writing in general is actually pretty interesting. i tought i wouldn't care at first but the stories really started growing on me.  i really enjoy the gameplay a lot. there are 2 things that do annoy me: sometimes you have nothing interesting left to do and you just end up grinding for energy which isn't hard but it's just boring. i also don't like how the stats of employees regress when left unattended (or maybe it's something else that makes them regress) the rest of the gameplay is pretty fun to me. i love picking between the 3 abnormalities every day upgrading the facilities and hiring employees is also very satisfying equipping items does leave something to be desired but thats because i don't like managing equipment.  the game itself is also very enjoyable. i love figuering out how to handle abnormalities and with 110 abnormalities in the game there is a lot to find out. it's always scary sending a good employee into the containment of an anomaly you don't fully understand yet. luckily you can restart the day without a penalty. i also love letting anomalies go haywire just to see what happens. i also like the addition of ordeals. at first i tought they were annoying but now i feel like they mix up the gameplay in an interesting way and it allows you to test out your unlocked weapons.  the game also managed to surprise me. i tought i was nearing the end of the game and suddenly the game throws more stuff at me i realise the game will even do this a 3rd time. i've already been playing for a long time so knowing there is more fun content to come in my playtrough really does make me feel like i got my money's worth  in conclusion the game has simple but nice graphics i also love the animations. the writing is very interesting even tough the translation isn't always optimal. some sounds do get annoying while others are very well done. the gameplay is fun if you like experimenting with life threatening things in a virtual environment. it' also fun if you like management games. i wouldn't know how replayable it is but as long as there are abnormalities to explore i don't think this game will become boring (as a reference during the time i played i've only tested on 24/110 abnormalities)
the equivalent of trying to keep children alive while trying to walk them through a minefield. i was never more confused on why my crew kept on dying outside of my view.

an amazing game altogether. they fixed the translation so any problems i previously had are null  a lot of people will recommend it as a good game for people who like scp. but even if you don't know about it or don't like scp you can enjoy this game.  this game is not for everybody however as there are several massive difficulty spikes and points where you are basically forced to restart from the begining due to either bad luck or lack of skills/upgrades. luckily you keep a good amount of your progress

so everything was going pretty well on in the game until i got an outbreak of bug like things that eat people. so i sent a team to go deal with it. one of the team members was a spunky new guy i was using as a guinea pig to see what this artifact bracelet thing does. upon him seeing the bugs the bracelet decided he's not worthy and poisons him making his face puff up. the rest of the team got wiped out and eaten. but at the same time on a different floor an employee in the safe zone got possessed by the glasses that someone had given her and started running around spooking people. so i then instructed my dude with the holy wak-a-mole stick to slap some sense into her. apparently the dude had a dormant demon within him that suddenly remembered he can posses the dude all because he saw the possessed chick. so the holy stick man gets possessed grabs a fire ax and kills almost everyone. but he also kills all the bugs so that's good. however the glasses demon then mentally snaps out of fear of the stronger demon and starts getting chased all over the facility. also during the ensuing madness a dude got choked out by a teddy bear. 10/10 would watch my entire life's work go up in flames.

i adore this game quite a lot its very charming and pretty brutal. the overall theme is a depressing unforgiving and lethal world but it does try to be a bit hopeful. pretty much you have to manage your facility as you gain more and more creatures to contain and you will need to trial by fire each one and you will 100% take casualties and later your entire facility will more often than not be in peril and rng of which ones you get with what where and when can determine just how bad things really can get and let me tell you if your unlucky and still lacking strong e.g.o.(its the name of the gear the name makes sense later) it can get bad. like my current facility is filled with things that can and will breach off each-other.   its actually has a big rouge-like element where you can reset to certain imprints or even the first day and keep your gear and research/upgrades (employees however are reverted/lost so screenshot the ones you like so you can recreate them)  from a few waifus to mostly freaks of nature this game probably has quite a few of anomalies that may catch your eye in interest. certain combinations of abnormalities can fuck you really hard your 'first play-through' forcing you to reset early but i'm in my 1st 'reset to first day' play-through while running a no death policy where i will reset no matter who/how my agents (the controllable ones) die (this is way harder and way longer than just letting them die tbh) and i currently have a pretty freaking difficult facility and i'm still doing just fine so with a will there is a way but don't be afraid to reset it back to the first day(try to get as much gear as you can before that) as it can and will get much harder.  you will get pretty funny and unique egos like a powerful waw sniper rifle that the agent wielding should be alone 24/7(kinda fitting) as he will shoot through everything in the room including the red paste across the floor of the poor squad that you accidentally grouped him with.(also fitting)  it does have some mods on the nexus and are pretty easy to install and you can create your own character features like hair for example though a little annoying it seems. biggest complaint probably is performance as it.. runs really weird is the best way to describe it even with a performance mod.  so i think it personally sits at a 8.4/10   one last thing future run saving tip regarding the functions of a certain anomaly: you may get an anomaly that is a red button do not press it out the gate don't think about it instead make sure to get its 'observation' via clicking on its 'details' tab a lot in 'deployment' first but if you plan to see what it does face first i recommend taking all your gear off as that thing saves the game after you spam press it(not sure if its intentional either) as it grants its 'observation' which forces a save meaning all that gear your employees were wearing? gone no reset will fix it(it might be safe to press after getting its observation?). spoiler you say? very small but you would thank me for saving your gear. it does have cool effcts though and technically you can use its save feature beneficially. yea i spammed clicked it my first time i regret it wasn't the worst problem(i didn't have hard to get event gear at the time) but holy fuck it was annoying  it is a tad time consuming to get 100% upgrades and research. additionally this game has a sequel.  edits~~~ 5/9/20: the games translation has been updated and so will this just a bit originally i wrote that the translation was.. eh not the greatest but now its pretty good and i have even increased the rating by .4 although a little of the charm is gone due to the removal of the alien but poetic like writing but it still a good story. i also did other rewording and adding stuff  11/25/22 massive rewording/structuring since it was bugging me

it's a cute little game with super charming artwork in the segments between missions. i really enjoyed the story and the different abnormalities as well as their specific uh... management needs. i'm terrible at management sims but this one is pretty straight forward yet has a fair difficulty curve.  i'd say the only two things that really got to me were:   1) the english translation is easily understandable but the few errors you see here and there leave it short of feeling professional  2) there's a menu for each monster that allows you to unlock additional info on them pertaining to their habits and how to best deal with them. there's an avatar for the corresponding monster and it is... well hideous compared to the relatively pleasant artwork in the rest of the game. i mean everything's so cute and clean but the pictures for the monsters are blurry and plain. i don't understand but i guess it's just me knit-picking.  all in all it was a lot of fun and if you like management sims it might hold a few fun challenges for you. p.s.- you can edit the employees you hire to look anyway you want. i found this to be a huge plus personally.

this game is not what it seems at all. the best way that i can describe this game is like playing a purgatory simulator. that's not a bad thing however but it describes the kind of challenge this game will give you. as you progress through the game it just gets harder. without spoilers i'll be the first one to say that it really doesn;t feel like you have full control sometimes. you try your hardest to prevent an outbreak but then some eldritch/paranormal event takes place within your facility and things go to hell in mere seconds. you'll never know when it's coming (unless you pay attention to a meter. i don'l.t i get too caught up with research) and when it does you may not even be prepared. replayablity i'd say is this games motivation. with each level ompleted you gain more inforamtion every once and awhile on lore and characters. how the faciloty works. what it does to it's employees to make them feel like everything's okay. the game is like a rollercoaster that keeps endlessly crashing until your hit the replay button. now unlike darkes dungeon where losing charactrs is permanent you can get characters back through the save feature. but that's the problem sometimes the risk can be too great. i constantly have to decide if i want to revive a character i really like or finish the game for the day. trhis decision has made me reset to the point of insanity. i have restarted my campaign two times just to get a lucky roll of the dice. this is not a simulator. this is not a tycoon. this is a psychological test of your paitence and your drive to keep going. but every once in awhile sometimes you get that one beast you just don't want to deal with. but then you must decide if you want to restart or keep going. and endless cycle of wants and not-wants. i haven't beaten the game yet but i garuntee you this is not for casual gamers.

not much i can say without spoiling the surprise but this game is for sure a must-play if you enjoy management difficulty and horror especially. this is a game that will not go easy on you so be warned..

i have played this game since the bad english translation....and even back then i loved this game. small shoutout to sinvicta who is the youtuber that made me aware of this game.  first off let me prefice this by saying i hate horror games. and my biggest fear was that this was in fact a horror game. so i told myself that after seeing some videos to give it a try but if it played the jumpscare deal i would refund it. end result??? look at the amount of time played.  i love the game and i hear allot of talk about how the game is comparible to scp containment breach but i never played that. but the premise is as follows:  you are the new manager in lobotomy corp and you job is to manage your employees and collect positive energy from monster creatures and other abnormalities. but these abnormalities can kill your employees and hell even escape and murder a whole department.  now this game is build on the idea of save-scumming. allot of people dont like that but to meevery abnormality is a new puzzle to solve. plus the backstories on some of these abnormalities is absolutely fantastic. as a bit of a hobby writer myself i love the amount of detail some of these stories have and its a big reason i have been playing this game for so long.  all in all this game isn't easy. but the challenge the stories and the main storyline is what keeps me coming back. especially now that the bad translation is fixed. its worth every cent!!

ended up putting my playthrough as a personnel's experience (however i tried to make it vague so i could leave it to anyone's perspective neither do i know if i made in the perspective of a manager or a worker. the game is basically like trying to run an scp facility you can't ensure everyone will survive the abnormalities are not to be underestimated prepare countermeasures for dealing with them.)   [redacted]'s log  day 1 this job seems easy enough despite this abnormality's intimidating appearance it appears to be rather... docile? jeez if all abnormalties were like this then this job would've been easier than i thought.  day 2 huh? so there's a new abnormality brought here and it appears to be... a bird? i might be right about this job  day 3 errm... i think heard some sort of alarm go off...? why was there blood on the floor...? hm must've been some accident better not mind it...  ------ day 6 i skipped any mentions of my last 3 days it was just fine nothing to comment about well maybe i could comment about the new abnormalities brought here but everything seems pretty fine too. then i guess i shouldn't further comment about this day.  day 7 oh god some unknown abnormalities appeared in the hallway and tried to attack anyone in their sight... ...the control team showed up in time and took care of the situation. no one was killed this won't happen again right? i mean t-this has got to be one of those small random chances... right?  day 8 oh god... there's so much blood here... those things just kept coming... wait! there's been containment breaches on two levels the control team is struggling with constant moving from room to room and fighting again and again... oh god... o-03-60 got out and the both the information team and control team are trying to stop it... that control team member just went crazy! she's attacking everything even her own colleagues! ...the fighting is over.  but they shot her... they shot down their own colleague i-i know she went berserk b-but couldn't they just restrain her...? they could've saved her...  should i approach them...? wait... it's looks like one of them is trembling and begging for an end to all of this she doesn't look she could take it anymore-- hold on wait a minute! is that [redacted]!? oh god it's a lot more saddening... i knew her since-- no... it's not the time to be talking about the past our future awaits in our hands! ...but she dreamt of a job that would shape of the future of mankind but i guess this was too much for her... from now on i'll do everyone to keep everyone alive!  day 9 new day new recruit new abnormality. what could possibly go wrong!?   day [?] i lost track of the days... haven't gotten a chance to write a log until today.  this facility is just a madhouse! i witnessed a researcher somehow get decapitated by o-05-61... how did an old crumbling japanese armor manage to decapitate him!? but that's not the only thing that happened i also saw an agent losing her mind and ripping her own eyes out then sitting down and laughing right before she died... this is my fault if only i knew what i was getting them into why did i encourage them!?  day ??? o-03-60 is out again... another trail of carnage... we all know the drill keep your distance and don't fight it alone or in small numbers we need to gang up on it. ..... we managed the stop the killing spree however the newbie died on the first day. the poor guy hadn't gotten the proper equipment yet but still went straight at the thing you know very well we had to shoot the newbie down... once you lose it and go berserk there's no coming back. the causalties were significant but we can still replace them... later on one of the other new employees asked how do you even act so calm about all of this!? and with an emotionless look i replied you'll get used to it. ...none of this is my fault we can't save everyone.  day ...? i don't know if i can still go on... the contaiments have been breached most of the units or personnel have been slaughtered... working for this corporation was a mistake...  ...oh god i can hear footsteps nearby. i-it can't possibly be anything good... all i have is this handgun with me and it's not going to drop them dead before they get me.  the footsteps are getting even closer. i don't want any more of this.  i wish the best of luck to any new personnel of any other facility if they exist out there and if it's a new manager i beg you make the right choices... or all of us will be doomed. shit i just the door open! with my own handgun pointed against my head i'll let you know this is the end of the log. farewell.

i bought this game during legacy (version before this one where you didn't have a visual for artifical information. [i'll be referring to them as a.i. past this point.] personally they should have been called agumented since they didn't have full control over themselves like anegla as they each followed a predetermined path way and way they acted. (don't spoil the story much after that.) during the legacy version you would make your weapons instead of buying them from the creatures p.e box. such making sheild s that would kill you if you went into crumbling armour. same for lifestyles such as pacifist or rationalist. based on your actionspersonality and weapon you could have your units walk in and die before you even knew why. personally the legacy was very fun as the game was so new there was almost no information on it. more... hell but you can finish the days even if you have just one agent standing or none if your lucky with leftover lob. the missions were very nice add-on as well as the a.i. as they each have their own part of a him an emotion. from how a human thinkshow they actand as well as to how they even what we can get addicted to. there is some information from legacy i wish would be uncovered here though. such as the mist war that some certain creatures reference to a form of war.  most of the abnormalities have gotten redone from what i've notice mainly those that killed based on weapon and lifestyle. as well as the creatures/machines that were effecting gender based characters. it would be amazing if they would sell the creature slots to other players if they were in need of some more monster ideas. i could think of a few personally.   we could also use more information about just the world they all love in that we bossed them to do. personally based on each ending i would be [h1] disclaimer: this is a first impressions review and not a full review [/h1]  lobotomy corporation | monster management simulation is a game developed and published by project moon  the game offers some pleasant graphics and really vibrant colours although some ugly glitches here and there it is pleasant all the same. the game has a very distinctive art style which i geniunely like and makes the game really stand out  it's not an easy game to understand especially with it's tutorial. the game is really a trial and error game you experiment and see which thing works best it can all go wrong and sometimes you will have to restart from the beginning but overall after a while of playing you get used to the game's features and mechanics. the game does suffer with some repetitiveness at certain areas of the game but a fun game nontheless  lobotomy corporation | monster management simulation overall however is a fun game to play in short bursts!  [h1] recommended :) [/h1]  [b] review sources: [/b] [list] [*] none

i love this game the twisted world the strange weaponry the feeling when all your efforts crumble and this takes you further and further try and try again to figure out whats really happening. i love the thought put into this game the amount of lore you can uncover (lore!!!). this game is a bit difficult but it is entirely worth it the information you learn with every failure will help you strive and clear the next day making it that much sweeter i would highly recommend it.

the management of the game seems easy and lack depth but once the harder abnormalities show up it becomes so much more enjoyable if you don't like save scumming then this game will be so much harder as some abnormalities can instantly kill your employees without warning so getting new abnormalities is always a risk; all your choices have a risk of killing your high level employee pick carefully.  pro's; - complex but manageable. - loads of abnormalities. - cute dog pictures are required. - manageable difficulty curve.  con's - bad translation; originally korean english grammer is horrible but haven't found anything to be wrong in info just misleading. - no clear save time; while not always i did lose a day for not quiting at the right time. - repetitive music first hour its good but you easily spend several hours in the game with one sound track. (there more but you mostly hear one.)  on the fence; - art style its for a specific group i personally don't enjoy the flash style art while there is an ingame reason why it's like this. it's still puts me off. not enough to make it a con though. - instant kills there several abnormalities with instant kill abilities that have no warning until you get the tips or persist over a single play through  of the two i met one just completely removes a character from doing attachment other just blocks them from working on him (but don't get 12 marked)

it's a shame that this game seems so underrated and under-exposed because this is without a doubt one of the best games i've played this year (2018).  the game mechanics are simple and easy to grasp but the intensity of the game rises smoothly and caps off with incredibly difficult and fun challenges at the end.  the best part of this game though is its story. although the english translation could definitely use some minor touch-ups and corrections the setting for this game is wonderfully colorful and its plot is filled with unexpected and thrilling twists. also the character design is great. (hod is my waifu.)  i would definitely recommend this game to anyone looking for a simple yet engaging experience!

it's been years since it felt like i've played something new.  lc took me by surprise. while the explanation of the game the screenshots made it feel like it was going to be a base-builder with monster customization i could not have been more wrong.  without spoiling too much(because exploration and making mistakes are what makes up the content for this game) lc is basically a monster management game. there are no basebuilding aspects and managing monsters day to day is going to be the focus of your time. another big axis of the game is its story - it takes up a huge part in the entertainment value. lc also has replayability as it is virtually impossible to see all the 'monsters' in 1 go (and that's a good thing).  all in all if you absolutely must have basebuilding lc is not for you. however if you are looking for a new alternate type of game that will give you the feels try lc. at the least it's going to be worth every dollar you spent for it.
i really enjoyed this game. you should get it if you like a good story.

i have to say. i never thought that containing monsters managing my energy levels would be so much fun and nightmare like. this game has great potential for what it goes for and has hit my expectations. i do recommend it for those who are looking for a challenge mangement type game. it keeps me on edge and thinking of what i need to do to contain some of these creatures. the game starts off as a big gamble of what is what and how to deal with it. you never know unles you try it out and lose a few in the process. i do like the start over with all your equipment still intact idea.  well off to work in another nightmare land.

lobotomy corporation ‚Äì game review  do you remember a few years back when spc was big deal? a fictional facility that captures and secures paranormal and often dangerous entities and with no regards to human life. it even sparked a few horror-games who where played by the likes of markiplier or pewdiepie in their early days.  well lobotomy corporation first started as a student project by some korean dudes takes the idea of scp but instead as playing a poor grunt who tries to escape from the various monsters you take the role of the manager of such a facility... well kinda. let me explain.   gameplay:  fortunately you have a few ai-companions who do must of the paperwork for you so you can focus entirely on the monsters. unfortunately this will also be the only thing you can really do. despite the description this is not a management-tycoon-game. you cannot plan the layout of your facility you have no budget to look after there is no really tec-tree... nothing. it is for the best when you see this game more as an rpg. you hire employees and train and equip them for the increasingly harder monsters. you need the right employee with the right stats and resistance for the right monster. the problem now is that you start with zero information zero equipment and zero knowledge. sacrifices are your bred and butter in the first few runs of the game. you send employees basically to die into the champers of the monsters just to figure out what hey like and what they don't like ‚Äì while also praying that you do not piss them enough off to trigger a escape which in early game always means a game over. equipment can also only be purchased by working with the monsters and the harder the monster the better the equipment. but on the other hand you only get more experience points (that you also use to hire new guys) by a better performance per day. in other words: the more people die the less experience points you get. and so a downwards spiral begins.  let me make this clear: you will arrive in dead ends where you simply cannot continue the game.  but you as the manager have one last resort. you can manipulate time. this for one explains why you can pause and fast forward but this neat tool also enables you to restart a day to try to perform better. or you can go back a few days or even start at day one. in he latter cases you keep all your unlocked information equipment and upgrades which help you for the next try. and trust me you will start over again and again. lobotomy corporation is a grindy game where every piece of information is fought for and often worth an entire restart. lobotomy corporation is also a hard game. a very hard game. i did mention that this was made by koreans yes? well as you may know asians do prefer a little higher difficulty than europeans and with this said... this game will fuck like no tomorrow on several occasions. there are some upgrades that make things easier for you but they are locked behind missions the ai's give you and some of the later ones are brutal. and this upgrades ‚Äì when we boil it down - just help you to get through the early days faster just so you can tackle the harder challenges in the later game. and the challenges never stop. in the beginning it will be a big success to send someone into a room with an old broken armor without the employee dying while later on you have to fight god and the game-mechanics themselves.  this game knows how to make a situation worse and worse. in one moment everything seems fine and in the next a chain-reaction causes doom. add to that some very poorly optimized game-mechanics in some instances and frustration will arrive fast. often times i wanted to punch the wall give up and screamed at my monitor. i even took several week-long brakes to calm me down. but i always returned and faced the bullshit this game threw at me... and it was worth it. it can be addictive if you are a optimizer or a perfectionist. you always think: i can do better! and so you try again... ...and again... ...and again... ...just for the kick when you finally manage to overcome.  graphics:  if you believe it or not even the cartoonish graphics have an in-game explanation. they are quite charming. the employees look cute and there are a ton of gory death animations for them. the monsters have all a varied design and you always know who is who. some of the still-images from the cut-scenes look extremely gorgeous as well.   story:  while the monsters are the focus in the early game where you learn their often very interesting back-stories (often referring old fairy-tales or legends) there is also a overarching plot. in the middle of all of this are the ai's the past of the corporation and the mysterious founder a. let me tell you that all of the ai are batshit crazy and the more you play the more you learn about them and the dystopian world they live in.  between the days there are dialogues with the ai's in a visual-novel fashion and this how most the plot is told. the main-story will be the driving force in the latter half of the game and depending on your stance you can call it pretentious meh or phenomenal. you can tell that the makers are fans of neon genesis evangelion with its dark intriguing plot and symbols. in the 50 days to the finale you will experience a lot of crazy plot-twits tragic back-stories complicated words and darker themes in a hopeless world. i will admit that i was gripped by the story and one reason i pushed through was because i wanted to see how all of this ends. i even got emotional on a few occasions. the end can be little controversial because it is a little open ended. but there is also a sequel in the making so hey... there may be closure in the future. i also think that it is still a very nice end. so i do recommend this game just for the plot itself. but beware. because the studio is very small they could not hire a good translations team and sometimes the english sentences are a bit... messy.     music:  the music is surprisingly good in this game. i honestly did not expected such a great ost and its a shame that it can be nowhere brought. the different alarm-tunes are the highlights (and you will hear them often) but some of the tracks for the ai's or in the cutscenes are very nice too. in the finale there are also two tracks who stand a little bit out and do come from a different composer named dark fantasy studios... but goddammit they make that last day just so much more memorable.   end:  this game is honestly one of my favorites now. there is nothing really like it.  like i said this is not a tycoon-game.  it will force you to micromanage in sometimes very stressful situations. losing is part of the experience. people will die. insanity is behind every corner. you will pray for just one moment of good luck just for things to get even worse than before. often times there will be walls in front of you and you have no idea how to overcome them.  but in the end... everything will be okey. trust me.  if you like a interesting cryptic story with loads of mind-blowing moment you will like this game. if you like a good challenge this game is for you.  it was a wild ride for me that took me several months... but now it is completed. i have witnessed the ending-scene i worked so hard for... and know i feel empty... like a dear comrade just left. thank you projekt moon for this often frustrating bit still amazing experience.

fun game. it‚Äôs basically one of those management games where you manage dudes to do things and make sure you meet a certain quota for stuff.   however you have to manage a facility full with freaks of nature. kind of like those things in scp archives/containment breach and make sure the place does not end up as scp containment breach to where everything goes haywire. the games management part is that of solving basic maths on a calculator. tell dudes to go here and there nothing too complex just make sure none of the meters go down and you‚Äôll be good.   it has some minor grammatical errors due to random underpaid college interns. not like (writing something in native language then translate it to russian then back to native or giving me the ability to write something without spell-check) level of bad but it‚Äôs hard not to notice it. also the stat screens and stuff get too weird and finicky but i just randomly click everywhere and hope that they go away so it‚Äôs ok.  but the game itself is quite fun and enjoyable. it‚Äôs hard challenging sometimes even unforgiving and certain thing aren‚Äôt gonna be obvious straight away without trial and error. so caution is definitely advised as you will screw up you will make mistakes and you will lose people regardless but that‚Äôs the fun part make the best out of the worst situations. ohh yeah and it has cool story i guess.	  my review is good/10 would be 10 if it was 3d but that‚Äôs just me. i mean if you like ‚Äúpapers please‚Äù or ‚Äúdarkest dungeon‚Äù then you prop enjoy this... maybe.

great management game with scp setting. you always have expect unexpectable or you'll be screwed. there's a lot monster content some of them was created for fun (like ppodae) or to scare you and kill all your employees. you think you've got this and it's easy to control abnormalities? then prepare for ordeals where a random abnormality spawning for each departament you have. and with each ordeal they become stronger so you won't be able to abuse easy abnormalities to complete the game. you might even start a new game because it's impossible to progress in your current run where all your good employees died and you have no people to work with abnormalities. will you left your dead employees behind or you will repeat again and again that day when someone have to die? it's up to you.

this game is by far in my top 10 games of all time. i find the game so soothing to play i dont no why even tho it can drive you nuts at times it just so chill and enjoyable! a game based on sctps (i think i dont follow that stuff my bf told me about em)& you are the manager watching all your employs through cctv and ordering them to work with monsters people fairy tales from god knows where to get energy to power..... idk yet? or do i?!  lets hit it with pros & cons to make stuff simple for reading!  pros: ++graphics are adorable i love the art style behind this game so much. it's very simple but covers lots of details ++gameplay is very good i've never ran into a bug before other than 1 crash (thanks o-05-47!) ++story is actually good! it's complex and really intresting lore! the story is told in a visual novel style after finishing days. i've got to a max of 32 days before restarting for different reasons; seeing new abnormals pinned myself in a bad spot why nawt. ++the abnormals; theres legit tons of them so many different ones of different difficultys & uses or evil uses? agasint you? idk how to put that. theres lots of fun unquie interactions with different abnormals & so far i've not encountered any that are too samey which is great :d. favs so far have to be o-03-89 d-01-106 & f-01-57  cons: -- o-03-89 -- t-01-31 -- can be a bit difficult to learn at first & getting new abnormals can be scary & a pain but thats part of the fun -- trial and error can be a part in this game iron manning stuff can be very hard to do as having high leveled employs die can be very painful compared to most managment games -- biggest con of this game is translation. it's a koeron company and their english translation can be a bit off here and there but thats a pass by me as i do think there is only one person translating it for them as its a indie small studio.  overall i honestly give this 9/10 & i love this game so much! i'm not sure why i enjoy it so much but i do and i'm here to share that love!

an amazing underrated game in which you take care of monsters known as abnormalities. these creatures have a similarity to that of the scps of the scp foundation. care for them properly and they'll give you energy to run the facility and export power... treat them poorly however and watch as your facility is destroyed in less than a couple minutes if you piss off the right ones.  it is simple in nature but please please give it a try sometime. it's a game with fantastic gameplay and a really good story with little hints and pieces to put things together along the way. the english translation is still being updated but for now it's sensible enough and makes for a good game.  edit: okay so since my review i've doubled my time into the game and i have to say please get it if you enjoy trial-and-error survival gameplay with a deep story to follow. look at the screen shots the video's and consider all this.  -the game since full release has full english translation completed. -is now mod compatible. -takes little space and requires no internet to play. -the game has a lot of replay-ability and several techniques to be learned that can help your management life easier. it's even made to be replayed a couple of times you'll understand in time! -the games difficulty is scale-able and controllable (to some extent) this won't make sense right away but you'll figure out eventually that you can use this to make the game easier or harder for yourself! -the soundtrack is amazing and the storytelling they make with the team and budget they had is beautiful.  please i encourage you give it a try if this sounds promising to you. don't take just my word for it make sure the game appeals to you in its imagery themes and in gameplay. don't look in too much though! this game can be a lot of fun blind but be ready for some trial and error and remember; don't be afraid to restart!
do you like dark souls? do you like micromangement games? and do you like scps? well this is the the game for you!

the amount of hidden depth in this game is absolutely ridiculous. i picked this up as kind of a throw away game thinking i'd play for 12 hours or so and then forget about it. but nope. the gameplay is seriously ridiculously in depth as you get further into the game and the exact usage of how you lay out your facility can have massive effects on your run. the artwork is top notch. i let out a cackle every time some new monstrosity eats one of my people or explodes them from the inside out or sucks them into a black hole. the creatures are really interesting. the music is on point. and the story despite the sketchy translation is an absolute trip (and i'm honestly starting to wonder if its translation or just the fact that this game is written almost like a haiku). buy this. tell your friends about it. spread the love build the future.

[h1]every abnormality may not have [a] reason to exist but have [has an] intention to exist.[/h1]  --- welcome. welcome to lobotomy corporation. you have chosen or been chosen to join to one of the wings of the newly established energy company. i thought so much of lobotomy corporation that i elected to establish my administration here in the facility we so thoughtful provided energy to our benefactors and customers. i have been proud to call our new technology the salvation that will bring to the human race . and so whether you are here to stay or move on your way to parts unknown welcome to lobotomy corporation. it's safer here. ---  if you like scp or cthulhu mythos that kinda of stuff it's pretty good (at least for me). but beware it's very repetitive and grinding. that being said the best way to enjoy this game fully is not to go through any guides or gameplay videos experience it for yourself. beating the game is hard complete the game is even harder. expect yourself with huge grinding and repeat from start again and again. but in the end the reward is always satisfying  it's like opening paradox box a box that contains any source of great and unexpected surprises. if you already know what's  inside the boxes then the whole point of explore the unknown is already pointless.
